   20: 
   21: -module(port_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: %%%
   24: %%% Author: Bjorn Gustavsson; iter_max_ports contributed by Peter Hogfeldt.
   25: %%%
   26: 
   27: %%
   28: %% There are a lot of things to test with open_port(Name, Settings).
   29: %%
   30: %%   Name can be
   31: %%
   32: %%       {spawn, Command}
   33: %%         which according to The Book and the manual page starts an
   34: %%         external program. That is not true. It might very well be
   35: %%         a linked-in program (the notion of 'linked-in driver' is
   36: %%         silly, since any driver is 'linked-in').
   37: %%	  [Spawn of external program is tested.]
   38: %%
   39: %%       Atom
   40: %%         Read all contents of Atom, or write to it.
   41: %%
   42: %%       {fd, In, Out}
   43: %%       Open file descriptors In and Out. [Not tested]
   44: %%
   45: %%   PortSettings can be
   46: %%
   47: %%       {packet, N}
   48: %%         N is 1, 2 or 4.
   49: %%
   50: %%       stream (default)
   51: %%         Without packet length.
   52: %%
   53: %%       use_stdio (default for spawned ports)
   54: %%         The spawned process use file descriptors 0 and 1 for I/O.
   55: %%
   56: %%       nouse_stdio					[Not tested]
   57: %%         Use filedescriptors 3 and 4.  This option is probably only
   58: %%	   meaningful on Unix.
   59: %%
   60: %%       in (default for Atom)
   61: %%         Input only (from Erlang's point of view).
   62: %%
   63: %%       out
   64: %%         Output only (from Erlang's point of view).
   65: %%
   66: %%       binary
   67: %%         The port is a binary port, i.e. messages received and sent
   68: %%         to a port are binaries.
   69: %%
   70: %%       eof
   71: %%         Port is not closed on eof and will not send an exit signal,
   72: %%         instead it will send a {Port, eof} to the controlling process
   73: %%         (output can still be sent to the port (??)).
   74: %%
   75: 
   76: 
   77: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0, init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   78:          init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   79: -export([
   80:     bad_args/1,

   87:     close_deaf_port/1,
   88:     count_fds/1,

   90:     dying_port/1,
   91:     env/1,

   93:     exit_status/1,
   94:     exit_status_multi_scheduling_block/1,
   95:     huge_env/1,

   97:     input_only/1,

   99:     line/1,

  103:     mon_port_bad_remote_on_local/1,
  104:     mon_port_local/1,

  106:     mon_port_named/1,

  110:     mon_port_remote_on_remote/1,
  111:     mon_port_driver_die/1,

  113:     mul_basic/1,

  115:     name1/1,

  142: ]).

  145:          port_exit_demonitor_race/1,

  170: suite() ->
  171:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
  172:      {timetrap, {minutes, 1}}].
  173:

  175:     [otp_6224, {group, stream}, basic_ping, slow_writes,

  177:      {group, multiple_packets}, parallell, dying_port, dropped_commands,
  178:      port_program_with_path, open_input_file_port,
  179:      open_output_file_port, name1, env, huge_env, bad_env, cd,

  182:      stderr_to_stdout, otp_3906, otp_4389, win_massive,

  184:      exit_status_multi_scheduling_block, ports, spawn_driver,
  185:      spawn_executable, close_deaf_port, unregister_name,
  186:      port_setget_data,

  194:      mon_port_named,
  195:      mon_port_bad_named,

  197:      mon_port_name_demonitor,
  198:      mon_port_driver_die,
  199:      mon_port_down_sig,
  200:      {group, port_exit_signal_race}].
  201: 
  202: groups() ->
  203:     [{stream, [], [stream_small, stream_big]},
  204:      {options, [], [t_binary, eof, input_only, output_only]},
  205:      {multiple_packets, [], [mul_basic, mul_slow_writes]},
  206:      {tps, [], [tps_16_bytes, tps_1K]},
  207:      {port_exit_signal_race, [], [port_exit_monitor_race,
  208:                                   port_exit_demonitor_race,
  209:                                   port_exit_link_race,
  210:                                   port_exit_unlink_race,
  211:                                   port_exit_command_race,
  212:                                   port_exit_connect_race,
  213:                                   port_exit_close_race,
  214:                                   port_exit_exit_race,
  215:                                   port_exit_command_request_race,
  216:                                   port_exit_connect_request_race,
  217:                                   port_exit_close_request_race,
  218:                                   port_exit_control_request_race,
  219:                                   port_exit_call_request_race,
  220:                                   port_exit_info_request_race]}].
  221: 
  222: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) when Case =:= mon_port_driver_die;
  223:                                      Case =:= mon_port_driver_die_demonitor ->
  224:     case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
  225:         1 -> {skip, "Need 2 schedulers to run testcase"};
  226:         _ -> Config
  227:     end;
  228: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
  229:     [{testcase, Case} |Config].
  230: 
  231: end_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
  232:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
  233: 
  234: init_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  235:     ignore_cores:init(Config).
  236: 
  237: end_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  238:     ignore_cores:fini(Config).
  239: 
  240: 
  241: -define(WIN_MASSIVE_PORT, 50000).
  242: 
  243: %% Tests that you can open a massive amount of ports (sockets)
  244: %% on a Windows machine given the correct environment.
  245: win_massive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  246:     case os:type() of
  247:         {win32,_} ->
  248:             do_win_massive();
  249:         _ ->
  250:             {skip,"Only on Windows."}
  251:     end.
  252: 
  253: do_win_massive() ->
  254:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 6}),
  255:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+Q", "8192"]),
  256:     ok = rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,win_massive_client,[3000]),
  257:     peer:stop(Peer).
  258: 
  259: win_massive_client(N) ->
  260:     {ok,P}=gen_tcp:listen(?WIN_MASSIVE_PORT,[{reuseaddr,true}]),
  261:     L = win_massive_loop(P,N),
  262:     Len = length(L),
  263:     lists:foreach(fun(E) ->
  264:                           gen_tcp:close(E)
  265:                   end,
  266:                   L),
  267:     case Len div 2 of
  268:         N ->
  269:             ok;
  270:         _Else ->
  271:             {too_few, Len}
  272:     end.
  273: 
  274: win_massive_loop(_,0) ->
  275:     [];
  276: win_massive_loop(P,N) ->
  277:     case (catch gen_tcp:connect("localhost",?WIN_MASSIVE_PORT,[])) of
  278:         {ok,A} ->
  279:             case (catch gen_tcp:accept(P)) of
  280:                 {ok,B} ->
  281:                     %erlang:display(N),
  282:                     [A,B|win_massive_loop(P,N-1)];
  283:                 _Else ->
  284:                     [A]
  285:             end;
  286:         _Else0 ->
  287:             []
  288:     end.
  289: 
  290: 
  291: %% Test that we can send a stream of bytes and get it back.
  292: %% We will send only a small amount of data, to avoid deadlock.
  293: 
  294: stream_small(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  295:     stream_ping(Config, 512, "", []),
  296:     stream_ping(Config, 1777, "", []),
  297:     stream_ping(Config, 1777, "-s512", []),
  298:     ok.
  299: 
  300: %% Send big amounts of data (much bigger than the buffer size in port test).
  301: %% This will deadlock the emulator if the spawn driver haven't proper
  302: %% non-blocking reads and writes.
  303: 
  304: stream_big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  305:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 180}),
  306:     stream_ping(Config, 43755, "", []),
  307:     stream_ping(Config, 100000, "", []),
  308:     stream_ping(Config, 77777, " -s40000", []),
  309:     ok.
  310: 
  311: %% Sends packet with header size of 1, 2, and 4, with packets of various
  312: %% sizes.
  313: 
  314: basic_ping(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  315:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
  316:     ping(Config, sizes(1), 1, "", []),
  317:     ping(Config, sizes(2), 2, "", []),
  318:     ping(Config, sizes(4), 4, "", []),
  319:     ok.
  320: 
  321: %% Let the port program insert delays between characters sent back to
  322: %% Erlang, to test that the Erlang emulator can handle a packet coming in
  323: %% small chunks rather than all at once.
  324: 
  325: slow_writes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  326:     ping(Config, [8], 4, "-s1", []),
  327:     ping(Config, [10], 2, "-s2", []),
  328:     ok.
  329: 
  330: %% Test that we get {'EXIT', Port, einval} if we try to send a bigger
  331: %% packet than the packet header allows.
  332: bad_packet(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  333:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  334:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  335: 
  336:     bad_packet(PortTest, 1, 256),
  337:     bad_packet(PortTest, 1, 257),
  338:     bad_packet(PortTest, 2, 65536),
  339:     bad_packet(PortTest, 2, 65537),
  340:     ok.
  341: 
  342: bad_packet(PortTest, HeaderSize, PacketSize) ->
  343:     P = open_port({spawn, PortTest}, [{packet, HeaderSize}]),
  344:     P ! {self(), {command, make_zero_packet(PacketSize)}},
  345:     receive
  346:         {'EXIT', P, einval} -> ok;
  347:         Other -> ct:fail({unexpected_message, Other})
  348:     end.
  349: 
  350: make_zero_packet(0) -> [];
  351: make_zero_packet(N) when N rem 2 == 0 ->
  352:     P = make_zero_packet(N div 2),
  353:     [P|P];
  354: make_zero_packet(N) ->
  355:     P = make_zero_packet(N div 2),
  356:     [0, P|P].
  357: 
  358: %% Test sending bad messages to a port.
  359: bad_port_messages(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  360:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  361:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  362: 
  363:     bad_message(PortTest, {a,b}),
  364:     bad_message(PortTest, {a}),
  365:     bad_message(PortTest, {self(),{command,bad_command}}),
  366:     bad_message(PortTest, {self(),{connect,no_pid}}),
  367:     ok.
  368: 
  369: bad_message(PortTest, Message) ->
  370:     P = open_port({spawn,PortTest}, []),
  371:     P ! Message,
  372:     receive
  373:         {'EXIT',P,badsig} -> ok;
  374:         Other -> ct:fail({unexpected_message, Other})
  375:     end.
  376: 
  377: %% Tests various options (stream and {packet, Number} are implicitly
  378: %% tested in other test cases).
  379: 
  380: 
  381: %% Tests the 'binary' option for a port.
  382: 
  383: t_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  384:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 300}),
  385: 
  386:     %% Packet mode.
  387:     ping(Config, sizes(1), 1, "", [binary]),
  388:     ping(Config, sizes(2), 2, "", [binary]),
  389:     ping(Config, sizes(4), 4, "", [binary]),
  390: 
  391:     %% Stream mode.
  392:     stream_ping(Config, 435, "", [binary]),
  393:     stream_ping(Config, 43755, "", [binary]),
  394:     stream_ping(Config, 100000, "", [binary]),
  395:     ok.
  396: 
  397: name1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  398:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 100}),
  399:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  400:     Command = lists:concat([PortTest, " "]),
  401:     P = open_port({spawn, Command}, []),
  402:     register(myport, P),
  403:     P = whereis(myport),
  404:     Text = "hej",
  405:     myport ! {self(), {command, Text}},
  406:     receive
  407:         {P, {data, Text}} ->
  408:             ok
  409:     end,
  410:     myport ! {self(), close},
  411:     receive
  412:         {P, closed} -> ok
  413:     end,
  414:     undefined = whereis(myport),
  415:     ok.
  416: 
  417: %% Test that the 'eof' option works.
  418: 
  419: eof(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  420:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 100}),
  421:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  422:     Command = lists:concat([PortTest, " -h0 -q"]),
  423:     P = open_port({spawn, Command}, [eof]),
  424:     receive
  425:         {P, eof} ->
  426:             ok
  427:     end,
  428:     P ! {self(), close},
  429:     receive
  430:         {P, closed} -> ok
  431:     end,
  432:     ok.
  433: 
  434: %% Tests that the 'in' option for a port works.
  435: 
  436: input_only(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  437:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 300}),
  438:     expect_input(Config, [0, 1, 10, 13, 127, 128, 255], 1, "", [in]),
  439:     expect_input(Config, [0, 1, 255, 2048], 2, "", [in]),
  440:     expect_input(Config, [0, 1, 255, 2048], 4, "", [in]),
  441:     expect_input(Config, [0, 1, 10, 13, 127, 128, 255],
  442:                  1, "", [in, binary]),
  443:     ok.
  444: 
  445: %% Tests that the 'out' option for a port works.
  446: 
  447: output_only(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  448:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 100}),
  449:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  450: 
  451:     %% First we test that the port program gets the data
  452:     Filename = filename:join(Dir, "output_only_stream"),
  453:     Data = random_packet(35777, "echo"),
  454:     output_and_verify(Config, ["-h0 -o", Filename], Data),
  455:     Wait_time = 500,
  456:     test_server:sleep(Wait_time),
  457:     {ok, Written} = file:read_file(Filename),
  458:     Data = binary_to_list(Written),
  459: 
  460:     %% Then we test that any writes to stdout from
  461:     %% the port program is not sent to erlang
  462:     output_and_verify(Config, ["-h0"], Data),
  463:     ok.
  464: 
  465: output_and_verify(Config, Options, Data) ->
  466:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  467:     Command = lists:concat([PortTest, " " | Options]),
  468:     Port = open_port({spawn, Command}, [out]),
  469:     Port ! {self(), {command, Data}},
  470:     Port ! {self(), close},
  471:     receive
  472:         {Port, closed} -> ok;
  473:         Msg -> ct:fail({received_unexpected_message, Msg})
  474:     end.
  475: 
  476: %% Test that receiving several packages written in the same
  477: %% write operation works.
  478: 
  479: 
  480: %% Basic test of receiving multiple packages, written in
  481: %% one operation by the other end.
  482: mul_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  483:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 10}),
  484:     expect_input(Config, [0, 1, 255, 10, 13], 1, "", []),
  485:     expect_input(Config, [0, 10, 13, 1600, 32767, 65535], 2, "", []),
  486:     expect_input(Config, [10, 70000], 4, "", []),
  487:     ok.
  488: 
  489: %% Test reading a buffer consisting of several packets, some
  490: %% of which might be incomplete.  (The port program builds
  491: %% a buffer with several packets, but writes it in chunks with
  492: %% delays in between.)
  493: 
  494: mul_slow_writes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  495:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 4}),
  496:     expect_input(Config, [0, 20, 255, 10, 1], 1, "-s64", []),
  497:     ok.
  498: 
  499: %% Runs several port tests in parallell.  Each individual test
  500: %% finishes in about 5 seconds.  Running in parallell, all tests
  501: %% should also finish in about 5 seconds.
  502: 
  503: parallell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  504:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 5}),
  505:     Testers = [
  506:                fun() -> stream_ping(Config, 1007, "-s100", []) end,
  507:                fun() -> stream_ping(Config, 10007, "-s1000", []) end,
  508:                fun() -> stream_ping(Config, 10007, "-s1000", []) end,
  509: 
  510:                fun() -> expect_input(Config, [21, 22, 23, 24, 25], 1,
  511:                                      "-s10", [in]) end,
  512: 
  513:                fun() -> ping(Config, [10], 1, "-d", []) end,
  514:                fun() -> ping(Config, [20000], 2, "-d", []) end,
  515:                fun() -> ping(Config, [101], 1, "-s10", []) end,
  516:                fun() -> ping(Config, [1001], 2, "-s100", []) end,
  517:                fun() -> ping(Config, [10001], 4, "-s1000", []) end,
  518: 
  519:                fun() -> ping(Config, [501, 501], 2, "-s100", []) end,
  520:                fun() -> ping(Config, [11, 12, 13, 14, 11], 1, "-s5", []) end],
  521:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  522:     Pids = lists:map(fun fun_spawn/1, Testers),
  523:     wait_for(Pids),
  524:     ok.
  525: 
  526: wait_for([]) ->
  527:     ok;
  528: wait_for(Pids) ->
  529:     io:format("Waiting for ~p", [Pids]),
  530:     receive
  531:         {'EXIT', Pid, normal} ->
  532:             wait_for(lists:delete(Pid, Pids));
  533:         Other ->
  534:             ct:fail({bad_exit, Other})
  535:     end.
  536: 
  537: %% Tests starting port programs that terminate by themselves.
  538: %% This used to cause problems on Windows.
  539: 
  540: dying_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  541:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
  542:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  543: 
  544:     P1 = make_dying_port(Config),
  545:     P2 = make_dying_port(Config),
  546:     P3 = make_dying_port(Config),
  547:     P4 = make_dying_port(Config),
  548:     P5 = make_dying_port(Config),
  549: 
  550:     %% This should be big enough to be sure to block in the write.
  551:     Garbage = random_packet(16384),
  552: 
  553:     P1 ! {self(), {command, Garbage}},
  554:     P3 ! {self(), {command, Garbage}},
  555:     P5 ! {self(), {command, Garbage}},
  556: 
  557:     wait_for_port_exit(P1),
  558:     wait_for_port_exit(P2),
  559:     wait_for_port_exit(P3),
  560:     wait_for_port_exit(P4),
  561:     wait_for_port_exit(P5),
  562:     ok.
  563: 
  564: wait_for_port_exit(Port) ->
  565:     receive
  566:         {'EXIT', Port, _} ->
  567:             ok
  568:     end.
  569: 
  570: make_dying_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  571:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  572:     Command = lists:concat([PortTest, " -h0 -d -q"]),
  573:     open_port({spawn, Command}, [stream]).
  574: 
  575: %% Test that dropped port_commands work correctly.
  576: %% This used to cause a segfault.
  577: %%
  578: %% This testcase creates a port and then lets many processes
  579: %% do parallel commands to it. After a while it closes the
  580: %% port and we are trying to catch the race when doing a
  581: %% command while the port is closing.
  582: dropped_commands(Config) ->
  583:     %% Test with output callback
  584:     dropped_commands(Config, false, {self(), {command, "1"}}),
  585:     %% Test with outputv callback
  586:     dropped_commands(Config, true, {self(), {command, "1"}}).
  587: 
  588: dropped_commands(Config, Outputv, Cmd) ->
  589:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  590:     os:putenv("ECHO_DRV_USE_OUTPUTV", atom_to_list(Outputv)),
  591:     ok = load_driver(Path, "echo_drv"),
  592:     [dropped_commands_test(Cmd) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 100)],
  593:     timer:sleep(100),
  594:     erl_ddll:unload_driver("echo_drv"),
  595:     os:unsetenv("ECHO_DRV_USE_OUTPUTV"),
  596:     ok.
  597: 
  598: dropped_commands_test(Cmd) ->
  599:     spawn_monitor(
  600:       fun() ->
  601:               Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv"},
  602:                                       [{parallelism, true}]),
  603:               [spawn_link(fun() -> spin(Port, Cmd) end) || _ <- lists:seq(1,8)],
  604:               timer:sleep(5),
  605:               port_close(Port),
  606:               timer:sleep(5),
  607:               exit(nok)
  608:       end),
  609:     receive _M -> timer:sleep(5) end.
  610: 
  611: spin(P, Cmd) ->
  612:     P ! Cmd,
  613:     spin(P, Cmd).
  614: 
  615: 
  616: %% Tests that port program with complete path (but without any
  617: %% .exe extension) can be started, even if there is a file with
  618: %% the same name but without the extension in the same directory.
  619: %% (In practice, the file with the same name could be a Unix
  620: %% executable.)
  621: %%
  622: %% This used to failed on Windows (the .exe extension had to be
  623: %% explicitly given).
  624: %%
  625: %% This testcase works on Unix, but is not very useful.
  626: 
  627: port_program_with_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  628:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
  629:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  630:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  631: 
  632:     %% Create a copy of the port test program in a directory not
  633:     %% included in PATH (i.e. in priv_dir), with the name 'my_port_test.exe'.
  634:     %% Also, place a file named 'my_port_test' in the same directory.
  635:     %% This used to confuse the CreateProcess() call in spawn driver.
  636:     %% (On Unix, there will be a single file created, which will be
  637:     %% a copy of the port program.)
  638: 
  639:     PortTest = os:find_executable("port_test", DataDir),
  640:     io:format("os:find_executable(~p, ~p) returned ~p",
  641:               ["port_test", DataDir, PortTest]),
  642:     {ok, PortTestPgm} = file:read_file(PortTest),
  643:     NewName = filename:join(PrivDir, filename:basename(PortTest)),
  644:     RedHerring = filename:rootname(NewName),
  645:     ok = file:write_file(RedHerring, "I'm just here to confuse.\n"),
  646:     ok = file:write_file(NewName, PortTestPgm),
  647:     ok = file:write_file_info(NewName, #file_info{mode=8#111}),
  648:     PgmWithPathAndNoExt = filename:rootname(NewName),
  649: 
  650:     %% Open the port using the path to the copied port test program,
  651:     %% but without the .exe extension, and verified that it was started.
  652:     %%
  653:     %% If the bug is present the open_port call will fail with badarg.
  654: 
  655:     Command = lists:concat([PgmWithPathAndNoExt, " -h2"]),
  656:     P = open_port({spawn, Command}, [{packet, 2}]),
  657:     Message = "echo back to me",
  658:     P ! {self(), {command, Message}},
  659:     receive
  660:         {P, {data, Message}} ->
  661:             ok
  662:     end,
  663:     ok.
  664: 
  665: 
  666: %% Tests that files can be read using open_port(Filename, [in]).
  667: %% This used to fail on Windows.
  668: open_input_file_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  669:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  670: 
  671:     %% Create a file with the file driver and read it back using
  672:     %% open_port/2.
  673: 
  674:     MyFile1 = filename:join(PrivDir, "my_input_file"),
  675:     FileData1 = "An input file",
  676:     ok = file:write_file(MyFile1, FileData1),
  677:     case open_port(MyFile1, [in]) of
  678:         InputPort when is_port(InputPort) ->
  679:             receive
  680:                 {InputPort, {data, FileData1}} ->
  681:                     ok
  682:             end
  683:     end,
  684:     ok.
  685: 
  686: %% Tests that files can be written using open_port(Filename, [out]).
  687: open_output_file_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  688:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
  689:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  690: 
  691:     %% Create a file with open_port/2 and read it back with
  692:     %% the file driver.
  693: 
  694:     MyFile2 = filename:join(PrivDir, "my_output_file"),
  695:     FileData2_0 = "A file created ",
  696:     FileData2_1 = "with open_port/2.\n",
  697:     FileData2 = FileData2_0 ++ FileData2_1,
  698:     OutputPort = open_port(MyFile2, [out]),
  699:     OutputPort ! {self(), {command, FileData2_0}},
  700:     OutputPort ! {self(), {command, FileData2_1}},
  701:     OutputPort ! {self(), close},
  702:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(MyFile2),
  703:     FileData2 = binary_to_list(Bin),
  704:     ok.
  705: 
  706: %% Tests that all appropriate fd's have been closed in the port program
  707: count_fds(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  708:     case os:type() of
  709:         {unix, _} ->
  710:             PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  711:             Filename = filename:join(PrivDir, "my_fd_counter"),
  712: 
  713:             RunTest = fun(PortOpts) ->
  714:                               PortTest = port_test(Config),
  715:                               Command = lists:concat([PortTest, " -n -f -o", Filename]),
  716:                               Port = open_port({spawn, Command}, PortOpts),
  717:                               Port ! {self(), close},
  718:                               receive
  719:                                   {Port, closed} -> ok
  720:                               end,
  721:                               test_server:sleep(500),
  722:                               {ok, Written} = file:read_file(Filename),
  723:                               Written
  724:                       end,
  725:             <<4:32/native>> = RunTest([out, nouse_stdio]),
  726:             <<4:32/native>> = RunTest([in, nouse_stdio]),
  727:             <<5:32/native>> = RunTest([in, out, nouse_stdio]),
  728:             <<3:32/native>> = RunTest([out, use_stdio]),
  729:             <<3:32/native>> = RunTest([in, use_stdio]),
  730:             <<3:32/native>> = RunTest([in, out, use_stdio]),
  731:             <<3:32/native>> = RunTest([in, out, use_stdio, stderr_to_stdout]),
  732:             <<3:32/native>> = RunTest([out, use_stdio, stderr_to_stdout]);
  733:         _ ->
  734:             {skip, "Skipped on windows"}
  735:     end.
  736: 
  737: %%
  738: %% Open as many ports as possible. Do this several times and check
  739: %% that we get the same number of ports every time.
  740: %%
  741: 
  742: iter_max_ports(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  743:     %% The child_setup program might dump core if we get out of memory.
  744:     %% This is hard to do anything about and is harmless. We run this test
  745:     %% in a working directory with an ignore_core_files file which will make
  746:     %% the search for core files ignore cores generated by this test.
  747:     %%
  748:     Config2 = ignore_cores:setup(?MODULE, iter_max_ports, Config, true),
  749:     try
  750:         iter_max_ports_test(Config2)
  751:     after
  752:         ignore_cores:restore(Config2)
  753:     end.
  754: 
  755: 
  756: iter_max_ports_test(Config) ->
  757:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 30}),
  758:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  759:     Command = lists:concat([PortTest, " -h0 -q"]),
  760:     Iters = case os:type() of
  761:                 {win32,_} -> 4;
  762:                 _ -> 10
  763:             end,
  764:     %% Run on a different node in order to limit the effect if this test fails.
  765:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+Q", "2048"]),
  766:     L = rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,do_iter_max_ports,[Iters, Command]),
  767:     peer:stop(Peer),
  768: 
  769:     ct:log("Result: ~p",[L]),
  770:     all_equal(L),
  771:     all_equal(L),
  772:     {comment, "Max ports: " ++ integer_to_list(hd(L))}.
  773: 
  774: do_iter_max_ports(N, Command) when N > 0 ->
  775:     [max_ports(Command)| do_iter_max_ports(N-1, Command)];
  776: do_iter_max_ports(_, _) ->
  777:     [].
  778: 
  779: all_equal([E,E|T]) ->
  780:     all_equal([E|T]);
  781: all_equal([_]) -> ok;
  782: all_equal([]) -> ok.
  783: 
  784: max_ports(Command) ->
  785:     test_server:sleep(500),
  786:     Ps = open_ports({spawn, Command}, [eof]),
  787:     N = length(Ps),
  788:     close_ports(Ps),
  789:     io:format("Got ~p ports\n",[N]),
  790:     N.
  791: 
  792: close_ports([P|Ps]) ->
  793:     P ! {self(), close},
  794:     receive
  795:         {P,closed} ->
  796:             ok
  797:     end,
  798:     close_ports(Ps);
  799: close_ports([]) ->
  800:     ok.
  801: 
  802: open_ports(Name, Settings) ->
  803:     case os:type() of
  804:         {unix, freebsd} ->
  805:             %% FreeBsd has issues with sendmsg/recvmsg in fork
  806:             %% implementation and we therefore have to spawn
  807:             %% slower to make sure that we always hit the same
  808:             %% make roof.
  809:             test_server:sleep(10);
  810:         _ ->
  811:             test_server:sleep(5)
  812:     end,
  813:     case catch open_port(Name, Settings) of
  814:         P when is_port(P) ->
  815:             [P| open_ports(Name, Settings)];
  816:         {'EXIT', {Code, _}} ->
  817:             case Code of
  818:                 enfile ->
  819:                     [];
  820:                 emfile ->
  821:                     [];
  822:                 system_limit ->
  823:                     [];
  824:                 enomem ->
  825:                     [];
  826:                 Other ->
  827:                     ct:fail({open_ports, Other})
  828:             end;
  829:         Other ->
  830:             ct:fail({open_ports, Other})
  831:     end.
  832: 
  833: %% Tests that exit(Port, Term) works (has been known to crash the emulator).
  834: 
  835: t_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  836:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  837:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun suicide_port/1, [Config]),
  838:     receive
  839:         {'EXIT', Pid, die} ->
  840:             ok;
  841:         Other ->
  842:             ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  843:     end.
  844: 
  845: suicide_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  846:     Port = port_expect(Config, [], 0, "", []),
  847:     exit(Port, die),
  848:     receive after infinity -> ok end.
  849: 
  850: 
  851: tps_16_bytes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  852:     tps(16, Config).
  853: 
  854: tps_1K(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  855:     tps(1024, Config).
  856: 
  857: tps(Size, Config) ->
  858:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 5}),
  859:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  860:     Packet = list_to_binary(random_packet(Size, "e")),
  861:     Port = open_port({spawn, PortTest}, [binary, {packet, 2}]),
  862:     Transactions = 10000,
  863:     {Elapsed, ok} = test_server:timecall(?MODULE, tps,
  864:                                          [Port, Packet, Transactions]),
  865:     {comment, integer_to_list(trunc(Transactions/Elapsed+0.5)) ++ " transactions/s"}.
  866: 
  867: tps(_Port, _Packet, 0) -> ok;
  868: tps(Port, Packet, N) ->
  869:     port_command(Port, Packet),
  870:     receive
  871:         {Port, {data, Packet}} ->
  872:             tps(Port, Packet, N-1);
  873:         Other ->
  874:             ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  875:     end.
  876: 
  877: %% Line I/O test
  878: line(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  879:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 5}),
  880:     Siz = 110,
  881:     Packet1 = random_packet(Siz),
  882:     Packet2 = random_packet(Siz div 2),
  883:     %% Test that packets are split into lines
  884:     port_expect(Config,[{lists:append([Packet1, io_lib:nl(), Packet2,
  885:                                        io_lib:nl()]),
  886:                          [{eol, Packet1}, {eol, Packet2}]}],
  887:                 0, "", [{line,Siz}]),
  888:     %% Test the same for binaries
  889:     port_expect(Config,[{lists:append([Packet1, io_lib:nl(), Packet2,
  890:                                        io_lib:nl()]),
  891:                          [{eol, Packet1}, {eol, Packet2}]}],
  892:                 0, "", [{line,Siz},binary]),
  893:     %% Test that too long lines get split
  894:     port_expect(Config,[{lists:append([Packet1, io_lib:nl(), Packet1,
  895:                                        Packet2, io_lib:nl()]),
  896:                          [{eol, Packet1}, {noeol, Packet1},
  897:                           {eol, Packet2}]}], 0, "", [{line,Siz}]),
  898:     %% Test that last output from closing port program gets received.
  899:     L1 = lists:append([Packet1, io_lib:nl(), Packet2]),
  900:     S1 = lists:flatten(io_lib:format("-l~w", [length(L1)])),
  901:     io:format("S1 = ~w, L1 = ~w~n", [S1,L1]),
  902:     port_expect(Config,[{L1,
  903:                          [{eol, Packet1}, {noeol, Packet2}, eof]}], 0,
  904:                 S1, [{line,Siz},eof]),
  905:     %% Test that lonely <CR> Don't get treated as newlines
  906:     port_expect(Config,[{lists:append([Packet1, [13], Packet2,
  907:                                        io_lib:nl()]),
  908:                          [{noeol, Packet1}, {eol, [13 |Packet2]}]}],
  909:                 0, "", [{line,Siz}]),
  910:     %% Test that packets get built up to lines (delayed output from
  911:     %% port program)
  912:     port_expect(Config,[{Packet2,[]},
  913:                         {lists:append([Packet2, io_lib:nl(),
  914:                                        Packet1, io_lib:nl()]),
  915:                          [{eol, lists:append(Packet2, Packet2)},
  916:                           {eol, Packet1}]}], 0, "-d", [{line,Siz}]),
  917:     %% Test that we get badarg if trying both packet and line
  918:     bad_argument(Config, [{packet, 5}, {line, 5}]),
  919:     ok.
  920: 
  921: %% Test that redirection of standard error to standard output works.
  922: stderr_to_stdout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  923:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 1}),
  924:     %% See that it works
  925:     Packet = random_packet(10),
  926:     port_expect(Config,[{Packet,[Packet]}], 0, "-e -l10",
  927:                 [stderr_to_stdout]),
  928:     %% stream_ping(Config, 10, "-e", [stderr_to_stdout]),
  929:     %% See that it doesn't always happen (will generate garbage on stderr)
  930:     port_expect(Config,[{Packet,[eof]}], 0, "-e -l10", [line,eof]),
  931:     ok.
  932: 
  933: 
  934: bad_argument(Config, ArgList) ->
  935:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
  936:     case catch open_port({spawn, PortTest}, ArgList) of
  937:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
  938:             ok
  939:     end.
  940: 
  941: 
  942: %% 'env' option
  943: %% (Can perhaps be made smaller by calling the other utility functions
  944: %% in this module.)
  945: %%
  946: %% Test that the 'env' option works
  947: env(Config)  when is_list(Config) ->
  948:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 1}),
  949:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  950:     Temp = filename:join(Priv, "env_fun.bin"),
  951: 
  952:     PluppVal = "dirty monkey",
  953:     env_slave(Temp, [{"plupp",PluppVal}]),
  954: 
  955:     Long = "LongAndBoringEnvName",
  956:     os:putenv(Long, "nisse"),
  957: 
  958:     env_slave(Temp, [{"plupp",PluppVal},
  959:                      {"DIR_PLUPP","###glurfrik"}],
  960:               fun() ->
  961:                       PluppVal = os:getenv("plupp"),
  962:                       "###glurfrik" = os:getenv("DIR_PLUPP"),
  963:                       "nisse" = os:getenv(Long)
  964:               end),
  965: 
  966: 
  967:     env_slave(Temp, [{"must_define_something","some_value"},
  968:                      {"certainly_not_existing",false},
  969:                      {"ends_with_equal", "value="},
  970:                      {Long,false},
  971:                      {"glurf","a glorfy string"}]),
  972: 
  973:     %% A lot of non existing variables (mingled with existing)
  974:     NotExistingList = [{lists:flatten(io_lib:format("V~p_not_existing",[X])),false}
  975:                        ||  X <- lists:seq(1,150)],
  976:     ExistingList = [{lists:flatten(io_lib:format("V~p_existing",[X])),"a_value"}
  977:                     ||  X <- lists:seq(1,150)],
  978:     env_slave(Temp, lists:sort(ExistingList ++ NotExistingList)),
  979:     ok.
  980: 
  981: env_slave(File, Env) ->
  982:     F = fun() ->
  983:                 lists:foreach(fun({Name,Val}) ->
  984:                                       Val = os:getenv(Name)
  985:                               end, Env)
  986:         end,
  987:     env_slave(File, Env, F).
  988: 
  989: env_slave(File, Env, Body) ->
  990:     file:write_file(File, term_to_binary(Body)),
  991:     Program = ct:get_progname(),
  992:     Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  993:     Cmd = Program ++ " -pz " ++ Dir ++
  994:     " -noinput -run " ++ ?MODULE_STRING ++ " env_slave_main " ++
  995:     File ++ " -run erlang halt",
  996:     Port = open_port({spawn, Cmd}, [{env,Env},{line,256}]),
  997:     receive
  998:         {Port,{data,{eol,"ok"}}} ->
  999:             ok;
 1000:         {Port,{data,{eol,Error}}} ->
 1001:             ct:fail("eol error ~p\n", [Error]);
 1002:         Other ->
 1003:             ct:fail(Other)
 1004:     end.
 1005: 
 1006: env_slave_main([File]) ->
 1007:     {ok,Body0} = file:read_file(File),
 1008:     Body = binary_to_term(Body0),
 1009:     case Body() of
 1010:         {'EXIT',Reason} ->
 1011:             io:format("Error: ~p\n", [Reason]);
 1012:         _ ->
 1013:             io:format("ok\n")
 1014:     end,
 1015:     init:stop().
 1016: 
 1017: 
 1018: %% 'env' option
 1019: %%   Test bad environments.
 1020: bad_env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1021:     try_bad_env([abbb]),
 1022:     try_bad_env([{"key","value"}|{"another","value"}]),
 1023:     try_bad_env([{"key","value","value2"}]),
 1024:     try_bad_env([{"key",[a,b,c]}]),
 1025:     try_bad_env([{"key",value}]),
 1026:     try_bad_env({a,tuple}),
 1027:     try_bad_env(42),
 1028:     try_bad_env([a|b]),
 1029:     try_bad_env(self()),
 1030:     ok.
 1031: 
 1032: try_bad_env(Env) ->
 1033:     badarg = try open_port({spawn,"ls"}, [{env,Env}])
 1034: 	     catch
 1035: 		 error:badarg -> badarg
 1036: 	     end.
 1037: 
 1038: 
 1039: %% Test that we can handle a very very large environment gracefully.
 1040: huge_env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1041:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
 1042:     {Vars, Cmd} = case os:type() of
 1043:                       {win32,_} -> {500, "cmd /q /c ls"};
 1044:                       _ ->
 1045:                           %% We create a huge environment,
 1046:                           %% 20000 variables is about 25MB
 1047:                           %% which seems to be the limit on Linux.
 1048:                           {20000, "ls"}
 1049:                   end,
 1050:     Env = [{[$a + I div (25*25*25*25) rem 25,
 1051:              $a + I div (25*25*25) rem 25,
 1052:              $a + I div (25*25) rem 25,
 1053:              $a+I div 25 rem 25, $a+I rem 25],
 1054:             lists:duplicate(100,$a+I rem 25)}
 1055:            || I <- lists:seq(1,Vars)],
 1056:     try erlang:open_port({spawn,Cmd},[exit_status, {env, Env}]) of
 1057:         P ->
 1058:             receive
 1059:                 {P, {exit_status,N}} = M when N > 127->
 1060:                     %% If exit status is > 127 something went very wrong
 1061:                     ct:fail("Open port failed got ~p",[M]);
 1062:                 {P, {exit_status,N}} = M ->
 1063:                     %% We test that the exit status is an integer, this means
 1064:                     %% that the child program has started. If we get an atom
 1065:                     %% something went wrong in the driver which is not ok.
 1066:                     ct:log("Got ~p",[M]),
 1067:                     true = is_integer(N)
 1068:             end
 1069:     catch E:R ->
 1070:               %% Have to catch the error here, as printing the stackdump
 1071:               %% in the ct log is way to heavy for some test machines.
 1072:               ct:fail("Open port failed ~p:~p",[E,R])
 1073:     end.
 1074: 
 1075: %% Test to spawn program with command payload buffer
 1076: %% just around pipe capacity (9f779819f6bda734c5953468f7798)
 1077: pipe_limit_env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1078:     WSL = os:getenv("WSLENV") =/= false,
 1079:     Cmd = case os:type() of
 1080:               {win32,_} when WSL -> "cmd.exe /q /c wsl true";
 1081:               {win32,_} -> "cmd /q /c true";
 1082:               _ -> "true"
 1083:           end,
 1084:     CmdSize = command_payload_size(Cmd),
 1085:     Limits = [4096, 16384, 65536], % Try a couple of common pipe buffer sizes
 1086: 
 1087:     lists:foreach(fun(Lim) ->
 1088: 			  lists:foreach(fun(L) -> pipe_limit_env_do(L, Cmd, CmdSize)
 1089: 					end, lists:seq(Lim-5, Lim+5))
 1090: 		  end, Limits),
 1091:     ok.
 1092: 
 1093: pipe_limit_env_do(Bytes, Cmd, CmdSize) ->
 1094:     case env_of_bytes(Bytes-CmdSize) of
 1095: 	[] -> skip;
 1096: 	Env ->
 1097: 	    try erlang:open_port({spawn,Cmd},[exit_status, {env, Env}]) of
 1098: 		P ->
 1099: 		    receive
 1100: 			{P, {exit_status,N}} ->
 1101: 			    %% Bug caused exit_status 150 (EINVAL+128)
 1102: 			    0 = N
 1103: 		    end
 1104: 	    catch E:R ->
 1105: 		    %% Have to catch the error here, as printing the stackdump
 1106: 		    %% in the ct log is way to heavy for some test machines.
 1107: 		    ct:fail("Open port failed ~p:~p",[E,R])
 1108: 	    end
 1109:     end.
 1110: 
 1111: %% environ format: KEY=VALUE\0
 1112: env_of_bytes(Bytes) when Bytes > 3 ->
 1113:     [{"X",lists:duplicate(Bytes-3, $x)}];
 1114: env_of_bytes(_) -> [].
 1115: 
 1116: %% White box assumption about payload written to pipe
 1117: %% for Cmd and current environment (see spawn_start in sys_driver.c)
 1118: command_payload_size(Cmd) ->
 1119:     EnvSize = lists:foldl(fun(E,Acc) -> length(E) + 1 + Acc end,
 1120: 			  0, os:getenv()),
 1121:     {ok, PWD} = file:get_cwd(),
 1122:     (4                      % buffsz
 1123:      + 4                    % flags
 1124:      + 5 + length(Cmd) + 1  % "exec $Cmd"
 1125:      + length(PWD) + 1      % $PWD
 1126:      + 1                    % nullbuff
 1127:      + 4                    % env_len
 1128:      + EnvSize).
 1129: 
 1130: %%  Test bad 'args' options.
 1131: bad_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1132:     try_bad_args({args, [self()]}),
 1133:     try_bad_args({args, ["head" | "tail"]}),
 1134:     try_bad_args({args, ["head", "body" | "tail"]}),
 1135:     try_bad_args({args, [<<"head">>, <<"body">> | <<"tail">>]}),
 1136:     try_bad_args({args, not_a_list}),
 1137:     try_bad_args({args, ["string",<<"binary">>, 1472, "string"]}),
 1138:     try_bad_args({args, ["string",<<"binary">>], "element #3"}),
 1139:     ok.
 1140: 
 1141: try_bad_args(Args) ->
 1142:     badarg = try open_port({spawn_executable,"ls"}, [Args])
 1143: 	     catch
 1144: 		 error:badarg -> badarg
 1145: 	     end.
 1146: 
 1147: 
 1148: 
 1149: %% 'cd' option
 1150: %% (Can perhaps be made smaller by calling the other utility functions
 1151: %% in this module.)
 1152: %%
 1153: %% Test that the 'cd' option works
 1154: cd(Config)  when is_list(Config) ->
 1155:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 1}),
 1156: 
 1157:     Program = ct:get_progname(),
 1158:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1159:     TestDir = filename:join(DataDir, "dir"),
 1160:     Cmd = Program ++ " -pz " ++ DataDir ++
 1161:     " -noshell -s port_test pwd -s erlang halt",
 1162:     _ = open_port({spawn, Cmd},
 1163:                   [{cd, TestDir}, {line, 256}]),
 1164:     receive
 1165:         {_, {data, {eol, String}}} ->
 1166:             case filename_equal(String, TestDir) of
 1167:                 true ->
 1168:                     ok;
 1169:                 false ->
 1170:                     ct:fail({cd, String})
 1171:             end;
 1172:         Other2 ->
 1173:             ct:fail({env, Other2})
 1174:     end,
 1175:     _ = open_port({spawn, Cmd},
 1176:                   [{cd, unicode:characters_to_binary(TestDir)},
 1177:                    {line, 256}]),
 1178:     receive
 1179:         {_, {data, {eol, String2}}} ->
 1180:             case filename_equal(String2, TestDir) of
 1181:                 true ->
 1182:                     ok;
 1183:                 false ->
 1184:                     ct:fail({cd, String2})
 1185:             end;
 1186:         Other3 ->
 1187:             ct:fail({env, Other3})
 1188:     end,
 1189: 
 1190:     InvalidDir = filename:join(DataDir, "invaliddir"),
 1191:     try open_port({spawn, Cmd},
 1192:                   [{cd, InvalidDir}, exit_status, {line, 256}]) of
 1193:         _ ->
 1194:             receive
 1195:                 {_, {exit_status, _}} ->
 1196:                     ok;
 1197:                 Other4 ->
 1198:                     ct:fail({env, Other4})
 1199:             end
 1200:     catch error:eacces ->
 1201:             %% This happens on Windows
 1202:             ok
 1203:     end,
 1204: 
 1205:     %% Check that there are no lingering messages
 1206:     receive
 1207:         Other5 ->
 1208:             ct:fail({env, Other5})
 1209:     after 10 ->
 1210:             ok
 1211:     end.
 1212: 
 1213: %% Test that an emulator that has set it's cwd to
 1214: %% something other then when it started, can use
 1215: %% relative {cd,"./"} to open port and that cd will
 1216: %% be relative the new cwd and not the original
 1217: cd_relative(Config) ->
 1218: 
 1219:     Program = ct:get_progname(),
 1220:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1221:     TestDir = filename:join(DataDir, "dir"),
 1222: 
 1223:     Cmd = Program ++ " -pz " ++ filename:dirname(code:where_is_file("port_SUITE.beam")) ++
 1224:     " -noshell -s port_SUITE relative_cd -s erlang halt",
 1225: 
 1226:     _ = open_port({spawn, Cmd}, [{line, 256}, {cd, TestDir}]),
 1227: 
 1228:     receive
 1229:         {_, {data, {eol, String}}} ->
 1230:             case filename_equal(String, TestDir) of
 1231:                 true ->
 1232:                     ok;
 1233:                 false ->
 1234:                     ct:fail({cd_relative, String})
 1235:             end;
 1236:         Other ->
 1237:             ct:fail(Other)
 1238:     end.
 1239: 
 1240: relative_cd() ->
 1241: 
 1242:     Program = ct:get_progname(),
 1243:     ok = file:set_cwd(".."),
 1244:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1245: 
 1246:     Cmd = Program ++ " -pz " ++ Cwd ++
 1247:     " -noshell -s port_test pwd -s erlang halt",
 1248: 
 1249:     _ = open_port({spawn, Cmd}, [{line, 256}, {cd, "./dir"}, exit_status]),
 1250: 
 1251:     receive
 1252:         {_, {data, {eol, String}}} ->
 1253:             io:format("~s~n",[String]);
 1254:         Other ->
 1255:             io:format("ERROR: ~p~n",[Other])
 1256:     end.
 1257: 
 1258: filename_equal(A, B) ->
 1259:     case os:type() of
 1260:         {win32, _} ->
 1261:             win_filename_equal(A, B);
 1262:         _ ->
 1263:             A == B
 1264:     end.
 1265: 
 1266: win_filename_equal([], []) ->
 1267:     true;
 1268: win_filename_equal([], _) ->
 1269:     false;
 1270: win_filename_equal(_, []) ->
 1271:     false;
 1272: win_filename_equal([C1 | Rest1], [C2 | Rest2]) ->
 1273:     case tolower(C1) == tolower(C2) of
 1274:         true ->
 1275:             win_filename_equal(Rest1, Rest2);
 1276:         false ->
 1277:             false
 1278:     end.
 1279: 
 1280: tolower(C) when C >= $A, C =< $Z ->
 1281:     C + 32;
 1282: tolower(C) ->
 1283:     C.
 1284: 
 1285: %% Tests that child process deaths are managed correctly when there are
 1286: %%  a large amount of concurrently dying children. See ticket OTP-3906.
 1287: otp_3906(Config)  when is_list(Config) ->
 1288:     case os:type() of
 1289:         {unix, OSName} ->
 1290:             otp_3906(Config, OSName);
 1291:         _ ->
 1292:             {skipped, "Only run on Unix systems"}
 1293:     end.
 1294: 
 1295: -define(OTP_3906_CHILDREN,     1000).
 1296: -define(OTP_3906_EXIT_STATUS,  17).
 1297: -define(OTP_3906_PROGNAME,     "otp_3906").
 1298: -define(OTP_3906_TICK_TIMEOUT, 5000).
 1299: -define(OTP_3906_OSP_P_ERLP,   10).
 1300: -define(OTP_3906_MAX_CONC_OSP, 50).
 1301: 
 1302: otp_3906(Config, OSName) ->
 1303:     DataDir = filename:dirname(proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config)),
 1304:     {ok, Variables, _} = file:path_consult(code:get_path(),"variables"),
 1305:     case lists:keysearch('CC', 1, Variables) of
 1306:         {value,{'CC', CC}} ->
 1307:             PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1308:             Prog = otp_3906_make_prog(CC, PrivDir),
 1309:             {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1310:             OP = process_flag(priority, max),
 1311:             OTE = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1312:             FS = spawn_link(Node,
 1313:                             ?MODULE,
 1314:                             otp_3906_start_forker_starter,
 1315:                             [?OTP_3906_CHILDREN, [], self(), Prog]),
 1316:             Result = receive
 1317:                          {'EXIT', _ForkerStarter, Reason} ->
 1318:                              {failed, Reason};
 1319:                          {emulator_pid, EmPid} ->
 1320:                              case otp_3906_wait_result(FS, 0, 0) of
 1321:                                  {succeeded,
 1322:                                   ?OTP_3906_CHILDREN,
 1323:                                   ?OTP_3906_CHILDREN} ->
 1324:                                      succeeded;
 1325:                                  {succeeded, Forked, Exited} ->
 1326:                                      otp_3906_list_defunct(EmPid, OSName),
 1327:                                      {failed,
 1328:                                       {mismatch,
 1329:                                        {forked, Forked},
 1330:                                        {exited, Exited}}};
 1331:                                  Res ->
 1332:                                      otp_3906_list_defunct(EmPid, OSName),
 1333:                                      Res
 1334:                              end
 1335:                      end,
 1336:             process_flag(trap_exit, OTE),
 1337:             process_flag(priority, OP),
 1338:             peer:stop(Peer),
 1339:             case Result of
 1340:                 succeeded ->
 1341:                     ok;
 1342:                 _ ->
 1343:                     ct:fail(Result)
 1344:             end;
 1345:         _ ->
 1346:             {skipped, "No C compiler found"}
 1347:     end.
 1348: 
 1349: otp_3906_list_defunct(EmPid, OSName) ->
 1350:     % Guess ps switches to use and what to grep for (could be improved)
 1351:     {Switches, Zombie} = case OSName of
 1352:                              BSD when BSD == darwin;
 1353:                                       BSD == openbsd;
 1354:                                       BSD == netbsd;
 1355:                                       BSD == freebsd ->
 1356:                                  {"-ajx", "Z"};
 1357:                              _ ->
 1358:                                  {"-ef", "[dD]efunct"}
 1359:                          end,
 1360:     io:format("Emulator pid: ~s~n"
 1361:               "Listing of zombie processes:~n"
 1362:               "~s~n",
 1363:               [EmPid,
 1364:                otp_3906_htmlize(os:cmd("ps "
 1365:                                        ++ Switches
 1366:                                        ++ " | grep "
 1367:                                        ++ Zombie))]).
 1368: 
 1369: otp_3906_htmlize([]) ->
 1370:     [];
 1371: otp_3906_htmlize([C | Cs]) ->
 1372:     case [C] of
 1373:         "<" -> "&lt;" ++ otp_3906_htmlize(Cs);
 1374:         ">" -> "&gt;" ++ otp_3906_htmlize(Cs);
 1375:         _ ->   [C | otp_3906_htmlize(Cs)]
 1376:     end.
 1377: 
 1378: otp_3906_make_prog(CC, PrivDir) ->
 1379:     SrcFileName = filename:join(PrivDir, ?OTP_3906_PROGNAME ++ ".c"),
 1380:     TrgtFileName = filename:join(PrivDir, ?OTP_3906_PROGNAME),
 1381:     {ok, SrcFile} = file:open(SrcFileName, write),
 1382:     io:format(SrcFile,
 1383:               "int           ~n"
 1384:               "main(void)    ~n"
 1385:               "{             ~n"
 1386:               "   return ~p; ~n"
 1387:               "}             ~n",
 1388:               [?OTP_3906_EXIT_STATUS]),
 1389:     file:close(SrcFile),
 1390:     os:cmd(CC ++ " " ++ SrcFileName ++ " -o " ++ TrgtFileName),
 1391:     TrgtFileName.
 1392: 
 1393: 
 1394: otp_3906_wait_result(ForkerStarter, F, E) ->
 1395:     receive
 1396:         {'EXIT', ForkerStarter, Reason} ->
 1397:             {failed, {Reason, {forked, F}, {exited, E}}};
 1398:         forked ->
 1399:             otp_3906_wait_result(ForkerStarter, F+1, E);
 1400:         exited ->
 1401:             otp_3906_wait_result(ForkerStarter, F, E+1);
 1402:         tick ->
 1403:             otp_3906_wait_result(ForkerStarter, F, E);
 1404:         succeeded ->
 1405:             {succeeded, F, E}
 1406:     after
 1407:         ?OTP_3906_TICK_TIMEOUT ->
 1408:             unlink(ForkerStarter),
 1409:             exit(ForkerStarter, timeout),
 1410:             {failed, {timeout, {forked, F}, {exited, E}}}
 1411:     end.
 1412: 
 1413: otp_3906_collect([], _) ->
 1414:     done;
 1415: otp_3906_collect(RefList, Sup) ->
 1416:     otp_3906_collect(otp_3906_collect_one(RefList, Sup), Sup).
 1417: 
 1418: otp_3906_collect_one(RefList, Sup) ->
 1419:     receive
 1420:         Ref when is_reference(Ref) ->
 1421:             Sup ! tick,
 1422:             lists:delete(Ref, RefList)
 1423:     end.
 1424: 
 1425: otp_3906_start_forker(N, Sup, Prog) ->
 1426:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1427:     spawn_opt(?MODULE,
 1428:               otp_3906_forker,
 1429:               [N, self(), Ref, Sup, Prog],
 1430:               [link, {priority, max}]),
 1431:     Ref.
 1432: 
 1433: otp_3906_start_forker_starter(N, RefList, Sup, Prog) ->
 1434:     process_flag(priority, max),
 1435:     EmPid = os:getpid(),
 1436:     Sup ! {emulator_pid, EmPid},
 1437:     otp_3906_forker_starter(N, RefList, Sup, Prog).
 1438: 
 1439: otp_3906_forker_starter(0, RefList, Sup, _) ->
 1440:     otp_3906_collect(RefList, Sup),
 1441:     unlink(Sup),
 1442:     Sup ! succeeded;
 1443: otp_3906_forker_starter(N, RefList, Sup, Prog)
 1444:   when length(RefList) >= ?OTP_3906_MAX_CONC_OSP ->
 1445:     otp_3906_forker_starter(N, otp_3906_collect_one(RefList, Sup), Sup, Prog);
 1446: otp_3906_forker_starter(N, RefList, Sup, Prog)
 1447:   when is_integer(N), N > ?OTP_3906_OSP_P_ERLP ->
 1448:     otp_3906_forker_starter(N-?OTP_3906_OSP_P_ERLP,
 1449:                             [otp_3906_start_forker(?OTP_3906_OSP_P_ERLP,
 1450:                                                    Sup,
 1451:                                                    Prog)|RefList],
 1452:                             Sup,
 1453:                             Prog);
 1454: otp_3906_forker_starter(N, RefList, Sup, Prog) when is_integer(N) ->
 1455:     otp_3906_forker_starter(0,
 1456:                             [otp_3906_start_forker(N,
 1457:                                                    Sup,
 1458:                                                    Prog)|RefList],
 1459:                             Sup,
 1460:                             Prog).
 1461: 
 1462: otp_3906_forker(0, Parent, Ref, _, _) ->
 1463:     unlink(Parent),
 1464:     Parent ! Ref;
 1465: otp_3906_forker(N, Parent, Ref, Sup, Prog) ->
 1466:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn, Prog}, [exit_status, in]),
 1467:     Sup ! forked,
 1468:     receive
 1469:         {Port, {exit_status, ?OTP_3906_EXIT_STATUS}} ->
 1470:             Sup ! exited,
 1471:             otp_3906_forker(N-1, Parent, Ref, Sup, Prog);
 1472:         {Port, Res} ->
 1473:             exit(Res);
 1474:         Other ->
 1475:             exit(Other)
 1476:     end.
 1477: 
 1478: 
 1479: otp_4389(Config)  when is_list(Config) ->
 1480:     case os:type() of
 1481:         {unix, _} ->
 1482:             ct:timetrap({minutes, 4}),
 1483:             TCR = self(),
 1484:             %% On MacOS Catalina libc can return enoent instead of emfile for cwd
 1485:             BrokenCWD = (os:type() =:= {unix,darwin}) andalso element(1,os:version()) == 19,
 1486:             case get_true_cmd() of
 1487:                 True when is_list(True) ->
 1488:                     lists:foreach(
 1489:                       fun (P) ->
 1490:                               receive
 1491:                                   {P, ok} ->  ok;
 1492:                                   {P, Err} -> ct:fail(Err)
 1493:                               end
 1494:                       end,
 1495:                       lists:map(
 1496:                         fun(_) ->
 1497:                                 spawn_link(
 1498:                                   fun() ->
 1499:                                           process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1500:                                           case catch open_port({spawn, True},
 1501:                                                                [stream,exit_status]) of
 1502:                                               P when is_port(P) ->
 1503:                                                   receive
 1504:                                                       {P,{exit_status,_}} ->
 1505:                                                           TCR ! {self(),ok};
 1506:                                                       {'EXIT',_,{R2,_}}
 1507:                                                         when R2 == emfile;
 1508:                                                              R2 == eagain;
 1509:                                                              R2 == enomem;
 1510:                                                              R2 == enoent andalso BrokenCWD ->
 1511:                                                           TCR ! {self(),ok};
 1512:                                                       Err2 ->
 1513:                                                           TCR ! {self(),{msg,Err2}}
 1514:                                                   end;
 1515:                                               {'EXIT',{R1,_}}
 1516:                                                 when R1 == emfile;
 1517:                                                      R1 == eagain;
 1518:                                                      R1 == enomem;
 1519:                                                      R1 == enoent andalso BrokenCWD ->
 1520:                                                   TCR ! {self(),ok};
 1521:                                               Err1 ->
 1522:                                                   TCR ! {self(), {open_port,Err1}}
 1523:                                           end
 1524:                                   end)
 1525:                         end,
 1526:                         lists:duplicate(1000,[]))),
 1527:                     {comment,
 1528:                      "This test case doesn't always fail when the bug that "
 1529:                      "it tests for is present (it is most likely to fail on"
 1530:                      " a multi processor machine). If the test case fails it"
 1531:                      " will fail by deadlocking the emulator."};
 1532:                 _ ->
 1533:                     {skipped, "\"true\" command not found"}
 1534:             end;
 1535:         _ ->
 1536:             {skip,"Only run on Unix"}
 1537:     end.
 1538: 
 1539: get_true_cmd() ->
 1540:     DoFileExist = fun (FileName) ->
 1541:                           case file:read_file_info(FileName) of
 1542:                               {ok, _} -> throw(FileName);
 1543:                               _ -> not_found
 1544:                           end
 1545:                   end,
 1546:     catch begin
 1547:               %% First check in /usr/bin and /bin
 1548:               DoFileExist("/usr/bin/true"),
 1549:               DoFileExist("/bin/true"),
 1550:               %% Try which
 1551:               case filename:dirname(os:cmd("which true")) of
 1552:                   "." -> not_found;
 1553:                   TrueDir -> filename:join(TrueDir, "true")
 1554:               end
 1555:           end.
 1556: 
 1557: %% 'exit_status' option
 1558: %%
 1559: %% Test that the 'exit_status' option works
 1560: exit_status(Config)  when is_list(Config) ->
 1561:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 1}),
 1562:     port_expect(Config,
 1563:                 [{"x", [{exit_status, 5}]}],
 1564:                 1, "", [exit_status]),
 1565:     ok.
 1566: 
 1567: %% Test spawning a driver specifically
 1568: spawn_driver(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1569:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1570:     ok = load_driver(Path, "echo_drv"),
 1571:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv"}, []),
 1572:     Port ! {self(), {command, "Hello port!"}},
 1573:     receive
 1574:         {Port, {data, "Hello port!"}} = Msg1 ->
 1575:             io:format("~p~n", [Msg1]),
 1576:             ok;
 1577:         Other ->
 1578:             ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
 1579:     end,
 1580:     Port ! {self(), close},
 1581:     receive {Port, closed} -> ok end,
 1582: 
 1583:     Port2 = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv -Hello port?"},
 1584:                              []),
 1585:     receive
 1586:         {Port2, {data, "Hello port?"}} = Msg2 ->
 1587:             io:format("~p~n", [Msg2]),
 1588:             ok;
 1589:         Other2 ->
 1590:             ct:fail({unexpected2, Other2})
 1591:     end,
 1592:     Port2 ! {self(), close},
 1593:     receive {Port2, closed} -> ok end,
 1594:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "ls"}, [])),
 1595:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "cmd"}, [])),
 1596:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, os:find_executable("erl")}, [])),
 1597:     ok.
 1598: 
 1599: %% Test parallelism option of open_port
 1600: parallelism_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1601:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1602:     ok = load_driver(Path, "echo_drv"),
 1603:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv"},
 1604:                             [{parallelism, true}]),
 1605:     {parallelism, true} = erlang:port_info(Port, parallelism),
 1606:     Port ! {self(), {command, "Hello port!"}},
 1607:     receive
 1608:         {Port, {data, "Hello port!"}} = Msg1 ->
 1609:             io:format("~p~n", [Msg1]),
 1610:             ok;
 1611:         Other ->
 1612:             ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
 1613:     end,
 1614:     Port ! {self(), close},
 1615:     receive {Port, closed} -> ok end,
 1616: 
 1617:     Port2 = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv -Hello port?"},
 1618:                              [{parallelism, false}]),
 1619:     {parallelism, false} = erlang:port_info(Port2, parallelism),
 1620:     receive
 1621:         {Port2, {data, "Hello port?"}} = Msg2 ->
 1622:             io:format("~p~n", [Msg2]),
 1623:             ok;
 1624:         Other2 ->
 1625:             ct:fail({unexpected2, Other2})
 1626:     end,
 1627:     Port2 ! {self(), close},
 1628:     receive {Port2, closed} -> ok end,
 1629:     ok.
 1630: 
 1631: %% Test spawning an executable specifically
 1632: spawn_executable(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1633:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1634:     EchoArgs1 = filename:join([DataDir,"echo_args"]),
 1635:     ExactFile1 = filename:nativename(os:find_executable(EchoArgs1)),
 1636:     [ExactFile1] = run_echo_args(DataDir,[]),
 1637:     [ExactFile1] = run_echo_args(DataDir,[binary]),
 1638:     ["echo_args"] = run_echo_args(DataDir,["echo_args"]),
 1639:     ["echo_args"] = run_echo_args(DataDir,[binary, "echo_args"]),
 1640:     ["echo_arguments"] = run_echo_args(DataDir,["echo_arguments"]),
 1641:     ["echo_arguments"] = run_echo_args(DataDir,[binary, "echo_arguments"]),
 1642:     [ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1643:     run_echo_args(DataDir,[ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1644:     [ExactFile1] = run_echo_args(DataDir,[default]),
 1645:     [ExactFile1] = run_echo_args(DataDir,[binary, default]),
 1646:     [ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1647:     run_echo_args(DataDir,[switch_order,ExactFile1,"hello world",
 1648:                            "dlrow olleh"]),
 1649:     [ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1650:     run_echo_args(DataDir,[binary,switch_order,ExactFile1,"hello world",
 1651:                            "dlrow olleh"]),
 1652:     [ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1653:     run_echo_args(DataDir,[default,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1654: 
 1655:     [ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1656:     run_echo_args_2("\""++ExactFile1++"\" "++"\"hello world\" \"dlrow olleh\""),
 1657:     [ExactFile1,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1658:     run_echo_args_2(unicode:characters_to_binary("\""++ExactFile1++"\" "++"\"hello world\" \"dlrow olleh\"")),
 1659: 
 1660:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1661:     SpaceDir = filename:join([PrivDir,"With Spaces"]),
 1662:     file:make_dir(SpaceDir),
 1663:     Executable = filename:basename(ExactFile1),
 1664:     file:copy(ExactFile1,filename:join([SpaceDir,Executable])),
 1665:     ExactFile2 = filename:nativename(filename:join([SpaceDir,Executable])),
 1666:     chmodplusx(ExactFile2),
 1667:     io:format("|~s|~n",[ExactFile2]),
 1668:     [ExactFile2] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[]),
 1669:     ["echo_args"] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,["echo_args"]),
 1670:     ["echo_arguments"] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,["echo_arguments"]),
 1671:     [ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1672:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1673:     [ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1674:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[binary, ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1675: 
 1676:     [ExactFile2,"hello \"world\"","\"dlrow\" olleh"] =
 1677:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[binary, ExactFile2,"hello \"world\"","\"dlrow\" olleh"]),
 1678:     [ExactFile2,"hello \"world\"","\"dlrow\" olleh"] =
 1679:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[binary, ExactFile2,"hello \"world\"","\"dlrow\" olleh"]),
 1680: 
 1681:     [ExactFile2] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[default]),
 1682:     [ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1683:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[switch_order,ExactFile2,"hello world", "dlrow olleh"]),
 1684:     [ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1685:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,[default,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1686:     [ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1687:     run_echo_args_2("\""++ExactFile2++"\" "++"\"hello world\" \"dlrow olleh\""),
 1688:     [ExactFile2,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1689:     run_echo_args_2(unicode:characters_to_binary("\""++ExactFile2++"\" "++"\"hello world\" \"dlrow olleh\"")),
 1690: 
 1691:     ExeExt = filename:extension(ExactFile2),
 1692:     Executable2 = "spoky name"++ExeExt,
 1693:     file:copy(ExactFile1,filename:join([SpaceDir,Executable2])),
 1694:     ExactFile3 = filename:nativename(filename:join([SpaceDir,Executable2])),
 1695:     chmodplusx(ExactFile3),
 1696:     [ExactFile3] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,[]),
 1697:     ["echo_args"] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,["echo_args"]),
 1698:     ["echo_arguments"] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,["echo_arguments"]),
 1699:     [ExactFile3,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1700:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,[ExactFile3,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1701:     [ExactFile3] = run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,[default]),
 1702:     [ExactFile3,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1703:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,
 1704:                   [switch_order,ExactFile3,"hello world",
 1705:                    "dlrow olleh"]),
 1706:     [ExactFile3,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1707:     run_echo_args(SpaceDir,Executable2,
 1708:                   [default,"hello world","dlrow olleh"]),
 1709:     [ExactFile3,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1710:     run_echo_args_2("\""++ExactFile3++"\" "++"\"hello world\" \"dlrow olleh\""),
 1711:     [ExactFile3,"hello world","dlrow olleh"] =
 1712:     run_echo_args_2(unicode:characters_to_binary("\""++ExactFile3++"\" "++"\"hello world\" \"dlrow olleh\"")),
 1713:     {'EXIT',{enoent,_}} = (catch run_echo_args(SpaceDir,"fnurflmonfi",
 1714:                                                [default,"hello world",
 1715:                                                 "dlrow olleh"])),
 1716: 
 1717:     NonExec = "kronxfrt"++ExeExt,
 1718:     file:write_file(filename:join([SpaceDir,NonExec]),
 1719:                     <<"Not an executable">>),
 1720:     {'EXIT',{eacces,_}} = (catch run_echo_args(SpaceDir,NonExec,
 1721:                                                [default,"hello world",
 1722:                                                 "dlrow olleh"])),
 1723:     {'EXIT',{enoent,_}} = (catch open_port({spawn_executable,"cmd"},[])),
 1724:     {'EXIT',{enoent,_}} = (catch open_port({spawn_executable,"sh"},[])),
 1725:     case os:type() of
 1726:         {win32,_} ->
 1727:             test_bat_file(SpaceDir);
 1728:         {unix,_} ->
 1729:             test_sh_file(SpaceDir)
 1730:     end,
 1731:     ok.
 1732: 
 1733: unregister_name(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1734:     Cmd = case os:getenv("WSLENV") of
 1735:               false -> "sleep 5";
 1736:               _ -> "wsl.exe sleep 5"
 1737:           end,
 1738:     true = register(crash, open_port({spawn, Cmd}, [])),
 1739:     true = unregister(crash).
 1740: 
 1741: test_bat_file(Dir) ->
 1742:     FN = "tf.bat",
 1743:     Full = filename:join([Dir,FN]),
 1744:     D = [<<"@echo off\r\n">>,
 1745:          <<"echo argv[0]:^|%0^|\r\n">>,
 1746:          <<"if \"%1\" == \"\" goto done\r\n">>,
 1747:          <<"echo argv[1]:^|%1^|\r\n">>,
 1748:          <<"if \"%2\" == \"\" goto done\r\n">>,
 1749:          <<"echo argv[2]:^|%2^|\r\n">>,
 1750:          <<"if \"%3\" == \"\" goto done\r\n">>,
 1751:          <<"echo argv[3]:^|%3^|\r\n">>,
 1752:          <<"if \"%4\" == \"\" goto done\r\n">>,
 1753:          <<"echo argv[4]:^|%4^|\r\n">>,
 1754:          <<"if \"%5\" == \"\" goto done\r\n">>,
 1755:          <<"echo argv[5]:^|%5^|\r\n">>,
 1756:          <<"\r\n">>,
 1757:          <<":done\r\n">>,
 1758:          <<"\r\n">>],
 1759:     file:write_file(Full,list_to_binary(D)),
 1760:     EF = filename:basename(FN),
 1761:     [DN,"hello","world"] =
 1762:     run_echo_args(Dir,FN,
 1763:                   [default,"hello","world"]),
 1764:     %% The arg0 argument should be ignored when running batch files
 1765:     [DN,"hello","world"] =
 1766:     run_echo_args(Dir,FN,
 1767:                   ["knaskurt","hello","world"]),
 1768:     EF = filename:basename(DN),
 1769:     ok.
 1770: 
 1771: test_sh_file(Dir) ->
 1772:     FN = "tf.sh",
 1773:     Full = filename:join([Dir,FN]),
 1774:     D = [<<"#! /bin/sh\n">>,
 1775:          <<"echo 'argv[0]:|'$0'|'\n">>,
 1776:          <<"i=1\n">>,
 1777:          <<"while [ '!' -z \"$1\" ]; do\n">>,
 1778:          <<"    echo 'argv['$i']:|'\"$1\"'|'\n">>,
 1779:          <<"    shift\n">>,
 1780:          <<"    i=`expr $i + 1`\n">>,
 1781:          <<"done\n">>],
 1782:     file:write_file(Full,list_to_binary(D)),
 1783:     chmodplusx(Full),
 1784:     [Full,"hello","world"] =
 1785:     run_echo_args(Dir,FN,
 1786:                   [default,"hello","world"]),
 1787:     [Full,"hello","world of spaces"] =
 1788:     run_echo_args(Dir,FN,
 1789:                   [default,"hello","world of spaces"]),
 1790:     file:write_file(filename:join([Dir,"testfile1"]),<<"testdata1">>),
 1791:     file:write_file(filename:join([Dir,"testfile2"]),<<"testdata2">>),
 1792:     Pattern = filename:join([Dir,"testfile*"]),
 1793:     L = filelib:wildcard(Pattern),
 1794:     2 = length(L),
 1795:     [Full,"hello",Pattern] =
 1796:     run_echo_args(Dir,FN,
 1797:                   [default,"hello",Pattern]),
 1798:     ok.
 1799: 
 1800: 
 1801: 
 1802: chmodplusx(Filename) ->
 1803:     case file:read_file_info(Filename) of
 1804:         {ok,FI} ->
 1805:             FI2 = FI#file_info{mode = ((FI#file_info.mode) bor 8#00100)},
 1806:             file:write_file_info(Filename,FI2);
 1807:         _ ->
 1808:             ok
 1809:     end.
 1810: 
 1811: run_echo_args_2(FullnameAndArgs) ->
 1812:     Port = open_port({spawn,FullnameAndArgs},[eof]),
 1813:     Data = collect_data(Port),
 1814:     Port ! {self(), close},
 1815:     receive {Port, closed} -> ok end,
 1816:     parse_echo_args_output(Data).
 1817: 
 1818: 
 1819: run_echo_args(Where,Args) ->
 1820:     run_echo_args(Where,"echo_args",Args).
 1821: run_echo_args(Where,Prog,Args) ->
 1822:     {Binary, ArgvArg} = pack_argv(Args),
 1823:     Command0 = filename:join([Where,Prog]),
 1824:     Command = case Binary of
 1825:                   true -> unicode:characters_to_binary(Command0);
 1826:                   false -> Command0
 1827:               end,
 1828:     Port = open_port({spawn_executable,Command},ArgvArg++[eof]),
 1829:     Data = collect_data(Port),
 1830:     Port ! {self(), close},
 1831:     receive {Port, closed} -> ok end,
 1832:     parse_echo_args_output(Data).
 1833: 
 1834: pack_argv([binary|Args]) ->
 1835:     {true, pack_argv(Args, true)};
 1836: pack_argv(Args) ->
 1837:     {false, pack_argv(Args, false)}.
 1838: 
 1839: pack_argv(Args, Binary) ->
 1840:     case Args of
 1841:         [] ->
 1842:             [];
 1843:         [default|T] ->
 1844:             [{args,[make_bin(Arg,Binary) || Arg <- T]}];
 1845:         [switch_order,H|T] ->
 1846:             [{args,[make_bin(Arg,Binary) || Arg <- T]},{arg0,make_bin(H,Binary)}];
 1847:         [H|T] ->
 1848:             [{arg0,make_bin(H,Binary)},{args,[make_bin(Arg,Binary) || Arg <- T]}]
 1849:     end.
 1850: 
 1851: make_bin(Str, false) -> Str;
 1852: make_bin(Str, true) ->  unicode:characters_to_binary(Str).
 1853: 
 1854: collect_data(Port) ->
 1855:     receive
 1856:         {Port, {data, Data}} ->
 1857:             Data ++ collect_data(Port);
 1858:         {Port, eof} ->
 1859:             []
 1860:     end.
 1861: 
 1862: parse_echo_args_output(Data) ->
 1863:     [lists:last(string:lexemes(S,"|")) || S <- string:lexemes(Data,["\r\n",$\n])].
 1864: 
 1865: %% Test that the emulator does not mix up ports when the port table wraps
 1866: mix_up_ports(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1867:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1868:     ok = load_driver(Path, "echo_drv"),
 1869:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn, "echo_drv"}, []),
 1870:     Port ! {self(), {command, "Hello port!"}},
 1871:     receive
 1872:         {Port, {data, "Hello port!"}} = Msg1 ->
 1873:             io:format("~p~n", [Msg1]),
 1874:             ok;
 1875:         Other ->
 1876:             ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
 1877:     end,
 1878:     Port ! {self(), close},
 1879:     receive {Port, closed} -> ok end,
 1880:     loop(start, done,
 1881:          fun(P) ->
 1882:                  Q =
 1883:                  (catch erlang:open_port({spawn, "echo_drv"}, [])),
 1884:                  %%		       io:format("~p ", [Q]),
 1885:                  if is_port(Q) ->
 1886:                         Q;
 1887:                     true ->
 1888:                         io:format("~p~n", [P]),
 1889:                         done
 1890:                  end
 1891:          end),
 1892:     Port ! {self(), {command, "Hello again port!"}},
 1893:     receive
 1894:         Msg2 ->
 1895:             ct:fail({unexpected, Msg2})
 1896:     after 1000 ->
 1897:               ok
 1898:     end,
 1899:     ok.
 1900: 
 1901: loop(Stop, Stop, Fun) when is_function(Fun) ->
 1902:     ok;
 1903: loop(Start, Stop, Fun) when is_function(Fun) ->
 1904:     loop(Fun(Start), Stop, Fun).
 1905: 
 1906: 
 1907: %% Test that link to connected process is taken away when port calls
 1908: %% driver_exit() also when the port index has wrapped
 1909: otp_5112(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1910:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1911:     ok = load_driver(Path, "exit_drv"),
 1912:     Port = otp_5112_get_wrapped_port(),
 1913:     io:format("Max ports: ~p~n",[max_ports()]),
 1914:     io:format("Port: ~p~n",[Port]),
 1915:     {links, Links1} = process_info(self(),links),
 1916:     io:format("Links1: ~p~n",[Links1]),
 1917:     true = lists:member(Port, Links1),
 1918:     Port ! {self(), {command, ""}},
 1919:     wait_until(fun () -> lists:member(Port, erlang:ports()) == false end),
 1920:     receive after 1000 -> ok end, %% Give signal some time to propagate...
 1921:     {links, Links2} = process_info(self(),links),
 1922:     io:format("Links2: ~p~n",[Links2]),
 1923:     false = lists:member(Port, Links2), %% This used to fail
 1924:     ok.
 1925: 
 1926: otp_5112_get_wrapped_port() ->
 1927:     P1 = erlang:open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, []),
 1928:     case port_ix(P1) < max_ports() of
 1929:         true ->
 1930:             io:format("Need to wrap port index (~p)~n", [P1]),
 1931:             otp_5112_wrap_port_ix([P1]),
 1932:             P2 = erlang:open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, []),
 1933:             false = port_ix(P2) < max_ports(),
 1934:             P2;
 1935:         false ->
 1936:             io:format("Port index already wrapped (~p)~n", [P1]),
 1937:             P1
 1938:     end.
 1939: 
 1940: otp_5112_wrap_port_ix(Ports) ->
 1941:     case (catch erlang:open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, [])) of
 1942:         Port when is_port(Port) ->
 1943:             otp_5112_wrap_port_ix([Port|Ports]);
 1944:         _ ->
 1945:             %% Port table now full; empty port table
 1946:             lists:foreach(fun (P) ->  P ! {self(), close} end,
 1947:                           Ports),
 1948:             ok
 1949:     end.
 1950: 
 1951: 
 1952: %% Test that port index is not unnecessarily wrapped
 1953: otp_5119(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1954:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1955:     ok = load_driver(Path, "exit_drv"),
 1956:     PI1 = port_ix(otp_5119_fill_empty_port_tab([])),
 1957:     Port2 = erlang:open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, []),
 1958:     PI2 = port_ix(Port2),
 1959:     {PortIx1, PortIx2} = case PI2 > PI1 of
 1960:                              true ->
 1961:                                  {PI1, PI2};
 1962:                              false ->
 1963:                                  {port_ix(otp_5119_fill_empty_port_tab([Port2])),
 1964:                                   port_ix(erlang:open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, []))}
 1965:                          end,
 1966:     MaxPorts = max_ports(),
 1967:     io:format("PortIx1 = ~p ~p~n", [PI1, PortIx1]),
 1968:     io:format("PortIx2 = ~p ~p~n", [PI2, PortIx2]),
 1969:     io:format("MaxPorts = ~p~n", [MaxPorts]),
 1970:     true = PortIx2 > PortIx1,
 1971:     true = PortIx2 =< PortIx1 + MaxPorts,
 1972:     ok.
 1973: 
 1974: otp_5119_fill_empty_port_tab(Ports) ->
 1975:     case (catch erlang:open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, [])) of
 1976:         Port when is_port(Port) ->
 1977:             otp_5119_fill_empty_port_tab([Port|Ports]);
 1978:         _ ->
 1979:             %% Port table now full; empty port table
 1980:             lists:foreach(fun (P) ->  P ! {self(), close} end,
 1981:                           Ports),
 1982:             [LastPort|_] = Ports,
 1983:             LastPort
 1984:     end.
 1985: 
 1986: max_ports() ->
 1987:     erlang:system_info(port_limit).
 1988: 
 1989: port_ix(Port) when is_port(Port) ->
 1990:     ["#Port",_,PortIxStr] = string:lexemes(erlang:port_to_list(Port),
 1991:                                           "<.>"),
 1992:     list_to_integer(PortIxStr).
 1993: 
 1994: 
 1995: %% Check that port command failure doesn't crash the emulator
 1996: otp_6224(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1997:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1998:     ok = load_driver(Path, "failure_drv"),
 1999:     Go = make_ref(),
 2000:     Failer = spawn(fun () ->
 2001:                            receive Go -> ok end,
 2002:                            Port = open_port({spawn, "failure_drv"},
 2003:                                             []),
 2004:                            Port ! {self(), {command, "Fail, please!"}},
 2005:                            otp_6224_loop()
 2006:                    end),
 2007:     Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Failer),
 2008:     Failer ! Go,
 2009:     receive
