 2010:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, Failer, Reason} ->
 2011:             case Reason of
 2012:                 {driver_failed, _} -> ok;
 2013:                 driver_failed -> ok;
 2014:                 _ -> ct:fail({unexpected_exit_reason,
 2015:                               Reason})
 2016:             end
 2017:     end,
 2018:     ok.
 2019: 
 2020: otp_6224_loop() ->
 2021:     receive _ -> ok after 0 -> ok end,
 2022:     otp_6224_loop().
 2023: 
 2024: 
 2025: -define(EXIT_STATUS_MSB_MAX_PROCS, 64).
 2026: -define(EXIT_STATUS_MSB_MAX_PORTS, 300).
 2027: 
 2028: exit_status_multi_scheduling_block(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2029:     Repeat = 3,
 2030:     case os:type() of
 2031:         {unix, _} ->
 2032:             ct:timetrap({minutes, 2*Repeat}),
 2033:             SleepSecs = 6,
 2034:             try
 2035:                 lists:foreach(fun (_) ->
 2036:                                       exit_status_msb_test(Config,
 2037:                                                            SleepSecs)
 2038:                               end,
 2039:                               lists:seq(1, Repeat))
 2040:             after
 2041:                 %% Wait for the system to recover (regardless
 2042:                 %% of success or not) otherwise later testcases
 2043:                 %% may unnecessarily fail.
 2044:                 receive after SleepSecs+500 -> ok end
 2045:             end;
 2046:         _ -> {skip, "Not implemented for this OS"}
 2047:     end.
 2048: 
 2049: exit_status_msb_test(Config, SleepSecs) when is_list(Config) ->
 2050:     %%
 2051:     %% We want to start port programs from as many schedulers as possible
 2052:     %% and we want these port programs to terminate while multi-scheduling
 2053:     %% is blocked.
 2054:     %%
 2055:     NoSchedsOnln = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 2056:     Parent = self(),
 2057:     io:format("SleepSecs = ~p~n", [SleepSecs]),
 2058:     PortProg = "sleep " ++ integer_to_list(SleepSecs),
 2059:     Start = erlang:monotonic_time(microsecond),
 2060:     NoProcs = case NoSchedsOnln of
 2061:                   NProcs when NProcs < ?EXIT_STATUS_MSB_MAX_PROCS ->
 2062:                       NProcs;
 2063:                   _ ->
 2064:                       ?EXIT_STATUS_MSB_MAX_PROCS
 2065:               end,
 2066:     NoPortsPerProc = case 20*NoProcs of
 2067:                          TNPorts when TNPorts < ?EXIT_STATUS_MSB_MAX_PORTS -> 20;
 2068:                          _ -> ?EXIT_STATUS_MSB_MAX_PORTS div NoProcs
 2069:                      end,
 2070:     io:format("NoProcs = ~p~nNoPortsPerProc = ~p~n",
 2071:               [NoProcs, NoPortsPerProc]),
 2072:     ProcFun
 2073:     = fun () ->
 2074:               PrtSIds = lists:map(
 2075:                           fun (_) ->
 2076:                                   erlang:yield(),
 2077:                                   case catch open_port({spawn, PortProg},
 2078:                                                        [exit_status]) of
 2079:                                       Prt when is_port(Prt) ->
 2080:                                           {Prt,
 2081:                                            erlang:system_info(scheduler_id)};
 2082:                                       {'EXIT', {Err, _}} when Err == eagain;
 2083:                                                               Err == emfile;
 2084:                                                               Err == enomem ->
 2085:                                           noop;
 2086:                                       {'EXIT', Err} when Err == eagain;
 2087:                                                          Err == emfile;
 2088:                                                          Err == enomem ->
 2089:                                           noop;
 2090:                                       Error ->
 2091:                                           ct:fail(Error)
 2092:                                   end
 2093:                           end,
 2094:                           lists:seq(1, NoPortsPerProc)),
 2095:               SIds = lists:filter(fun (noop) -> false;
 2096:                                       (_) -> true
 2097:                                   end,
 2098:                                   lists:map(fun (noop) -> noop;
 2099:                                                 ({_, SId}) -> SId
 2100:                                             end,
 2101:                                             PrtSIds)),
 2102:               process_flag(scheduler, 0),
 2103:               Parent ! {self(), started, SIds},
 2104:               lists:foreach(
 2105:                 fun (noop) ->
 2106:                         noop;
 2107:                     ({Port, _}) ->
 2108:                         receive
 2109:                             {Port, {exit_status, 0}} ->
 2110:                                 ok;
 2111:                             {Port, {exit_status, Status}} when Status > 128 ->
 2112:                                 %% Sometimes happens when we have created
 2113:                                 %% too many ports.
 2114:                                 ok;
 2115:                             {Port, {exit_status, _}} = ESMsg ->
 2116:                                 {Port, {exit_status, 0}} = ESMsg
 2117:                         end
 2118:                 end,
 2119:                 PrtSIds),
 2120:               Parent ! {self(), done}
 2121:       end,
 2122:     Procs = lists:map(fun (N) ->
 2123:                               spawn_opt(ProcFun,
 2124:                                         [link,
 2125:                                          {scheduler,
 2126:                                           (N rem NoSchedsOnln)+1}])
 2127:                       end,
 2128:                       lists:seq(1, NoProcs)),
 2129:     SIds = lists:map(fun (P) ->
 2130:                              receive {P, started, SIds} -> SIds end
 2131:                      end,
 2132:                      Procs),
 2133:     StartedTime = (erlang:monotonic_time(microsecond) - Start)/1000000,
 2134:     io:format("StartedTime = ~p~n", [StartedTime]),
 2135:     true = StartedTime < SleepSecs,
 2136:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 2137:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> receive {P, done} -> ok end end, Procs),
 2138:     DoneTime = (erlang:monotonic_time(microsecond) - Start)/1000000,
 2139:     io:format("DoneTime = ~p~n", [DoneTime]),
 2140:     true = DoneTime > SleepSecs,
 2141:     ok = verify_multi_scheduling_blocked(),
 2142:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 2143:     case {length(lists:usort(lists:flatten(SIds))), NoSchedsOnln} of
 2144:         {N, N} ->
 2145:             ok;
 2146:         {N, M} ->
 2147:             ct:fail("Failed to create ports on all ~w available"
 2148:                     "schedulers. Only created ports on ~w schedulers.", [M, N])
 2149:     end.
 2150: 
 2151: save_sid(SIds) ->
 2152:     SId = erlang:system_info(scheduler_id),
 2153:     case lists:member(SId, SIds) of
 2154:         true -> SIds;
 2155:         false -> [SId|SIds]
 2156:     end.
 2157: 
 2158: sid_proc(SIds) ->
 2159:     NewSIds = save_sid(SIds),
 2160:     receive
 2161:         {From, want_sids} ->
 2162:             From ! {self(), sids, NewSIds}
 2163:     after 0 ->
 2164:               sid_proc(NewSIds)
 2165:     end.
 2166: 
 2167: verify_multi_scheduling_blocked() ->
 2168:     Procs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 2169:                               spawn_link(fun () -> sid_proc([]) end)
 2170:                       end,
 2171:                       lists:seq(1, 3*erlang:system_info(schedulers_online))),
 2172:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 2173:     SIds = lists:map(fun (P) ->
 2174:                              P ! {self(), want_sids},
 2175:                              receive {P, sids, PSIds} -> PSIds end
 2176:                      end,
 2177:                      Procs),
 2178:     1 = length(lists:usort(lists:flatten(SIds))),
 2179:     ok.
 2180: 
 2181: 
 2182: %%% Pinging functions.
 2183: 
 2184: stream_ping(Config, Size, CmdLine, Options) ->
 2185:     Data = random_packet(Size),
 2186:     port_expect(Config, [{Data, [Data]}], 0, CmdLine, Options).
 2187: 
 2188: ping(Config, Sizes, HSize, CmdLine, Options) ->
 2189:     Actions = lists:map(fun(Size) ->
 2190:                                 [$p|Packet] = random_packet(Size, "ping"),
 2191:                                 {[$p|Packet], [[$P|Packet]]}
 2192:                         end,
 2193:                         Sizes),
 2194:     port_expect(Config, Actions, HSize, CmdLine, Options).
 2195: 
 2196: %% expect_input(Sizes, HSize, CmdLine, Options)
 2197: %%
 2198: %% Sizes = Size of packets to generated.
 2199: %% HSize = Header size: 1, 2, or 4
 2200: %% CmdLine = Additional command line options.
 2201: %% Options = Additional port options.
 2202: 
 2203: expect_input(Config, Sizes, HSize, CmdLine, Options) ->
 2204:     expect_input1(Config, Sizes, {HSize, CmdLine, Options}, [], []).
 2205: 
 2206: expect_input1(Config, [0|Rest], Params, Expect, ReplyCommand) ->
 2207:     expect_input1(Config, Rest, Params, [""|Expect], ["x0"|ReplyCommand]);
 2208: expect_input1(Config, [Size|Rest], Params, Expect, ReplyCommand) ->
 2209:     Packet = random_packet(Size),
 2210:     Fmt = io_lib:format("~c~p", [hd(Packet), Size]),
 2211:     expect_input1(Config, Rest, Params, [Packet|Expect], [Fmt|ReplyCommand]);
 2212: expect_input1(Config, [], {HSize, CmdLine0, Options}, Expect, ReplyCommand) ->
 2213:     CmdLine = build_cmd_line(CmdLine0, ReplyCommand, []),
 2214:     port_expect(Config, [{false, lists:reverse(Expect)}],
 2215:                 HSize, CmdLine, Options).
 2216: 
 2217: build_cmd_line(FixedCmdLine, [Cmd|Rest], []) ->
 2218:     build_cmd_line(FixedCmdLine, Rest, [Cmd]);
 2219: build_cmd_line(FixedCmdLine, [Cmd|Rest], Result) ->
 2220:     build_cmd_line(FixedCmdLine, Rest, [Cmd, $:|Result]);
 2221: build_cmd_line(FixedCmdLine, [], Result) ->
 2222:     lists:flatten([FixedCmdLine, " -r", Result, " -n"]).
 2223: 
 2224: %% port_expect(Actions, HSize, CmdLine, Options)
 2225: %%
 2226: %% Actions = [{Send, ExpectList}|Rest]
 2227: %% HSize = 0 (stream), or 1, 2, 4   (header size aka "packet bytes")
 2228: %% CmdLine = Command line for port_test.  Don't include -h<digit>.
 2229: %% Options = Options for open_port/2.  Don't include {packet, Number} or
 2230: %%           or stream.
 2231: %%
 2232: %% Send = false | list()
 2233: %% ExpectList = List of lists or binaries.
 2234: %%
 2235: %% Returns the port.
 2236: 
 2237: port_expect(Config, Actions, HSize, CmdLine, Options0) ->
 2238:     %    io:format("port_expect(~p, ~p, ~p, ~p)",
 2239:     %		[Actions, HSize, CmdLine, Options0]),
 2240:     PortTest = port_test(Config),
 2241:     Cmd = lists:concat([PortTest, " -h", HSize, " ", CmdLine]),
 2242:     PortType =
 2243:     case HSize of
 2244:         0 -> stream;
 2245:         _ -> {packet, HSize}
 2246:     end,
 2247:     Options = [PortType|Options0],
 2248:     ct:log("open_port({spawn, ~p}, ~p)", [Cmd, Options]),
 2249:     Port = open_port({spawn, Cmd}, Options),
 2250:     port_expect(Port, Actions, Options),
 2251:     Port.
 2252: 
 2253: port_expect(Port, [{Send, Expects}|Rest], Options) when is_list(Expects) ->
 2254:     port_send(Port, Send),
 2255:     IsBinaryPort = lists:member(binary, Options),
 2256:     Receiver =
 2257:     case {lists:member(stream, Options), line_option(Options)} of
 2258:         {false, _} -> fun receive_all/2;
 2259:         {true,false}  -> fun stream_receive_all/2;
 2260:         {_, true} -> fun receive_all/2
 2261:     end,
 2262:     Receiver(Port, maybe_to_binary(Expects, IsBinaryPort)),
 2263:     port_expect(Port, Rest, Options);
 2264: port_expect(_, [], _) ->
 2265:     ok.
 2266: 
 2267: %%% Check for either line or {line,N} in option list
 2268: line_option([{line,_}|_]) ->
 2269:     true;
 2270: line_option([line|_]) ->
 2271:     true;
 2272: line_option([_|T]) ->
 2273:     line_option(T);
 2274: line_option([]) ->
 2275:     false.
 2276: 
 2277: any_list_to_binary({Atom, List}) ->
 2278:     {Atom, list_to_binary(List)};
 2279: any_list_to_binary(List) ->
 2280:     list_to_binary(List).
 2281: 
 2282: maybe_to_binary(Expects, true) ->
 2283:     lists:map(fun any_list_to_binary/1, Expects);
 2284: maybe_to_binary(Expects, false) ->
 2285:     Expects.
 2286: 
 2287: port_send(_Port, false) -> ok;
 2288: port_send(Port, Send) when is_list(Send) ->
 2289:     %    io:format("port_send(~p, ~p)", [Port, Send]),
 2290:     Port ! {self(), {command, Send}}.
 2291: 
 2292: receive_all(Port, [Expect|Rest]) ->
 2293:     %    io:format("receive_all(~p, [~p|Rest])", [Port, Expect]),
 2294:     receive
 2295:         {Port, {data, Expect}} ->
 2296:             io:format("Received ~s", [format(Expect)]),
 2297:             ok;
 2298:         {Port, {data, Other}} ->
 2299:             io:format("Received ~s; expected ~s",
 2300:                       [format(Other), format(Expect)]),
 2301:             ct:fail(bad_message);
 2302:         Other ->
 2303:             %% (We're not yet prepared for receiving both 'eol' and
 2304:             %% 'exit_status'; remember that they may appear in any order.)
 2305:             case {Expect, Rest, Other} of
 2306:                 {eof, [], {Port, eof}} ->
 2307:                     io:format("Received soft EOF.",[]),
 2308:                     ok;
 2309:                 {{exit_status, S}, [], {Port, {exit_status, S}}} ->
 2310:                     io:format("Received exit status ~p.",[S]),
 2311:                     ok;
 2312:                 _ ->
 2313:                     %%%	            io:format("Unexpected message: ~s", [format(Other)]),
 2314:                     io:format("Unexpected message: ~w", [Other]),
 2315:                     ct:fail(unexpected_message)
 2316:             end
 2317:     end,
 2318:     receive_all(Port, Rest);
 2319: receive_all(_Port, []) ->
 2320:     ok.
 2321: 
 2322: stream_receive_all(Port, [Expect]) ->
 2323:     stream_receive_all1(Port, Expect).
 2324: 
 2325: stream_receive_all1(_Port, Empty) when is_binary(Empty), size(Empty) == 0 ->
 2326:     ok;
 2327: stream_receive_all1(_Port, []) ->
 2328:     ok;
 2329: stream_receive_all1(Port, Expect) ->
 2330:     receive
 2331:         {Port, {data, Data}} ->
 2332:             Remaining = compare(Data, Expect),
 2333:             stream_receive_all1(Port, Remaining);
 2334:         Other ->
 2335:             ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
 2336:     end.
 2337: 
 2338: compare(B1, B2) when is_binary(B1), is_binary(B2), byte_size(B1) =< byte_size(B2) ->
 2339:     case split_binary(B2, size(B1)) of
 2340:         {B1,Remaining} ->
 2341:             Remaining;
 2342:         _Other ->
 2343:             ct:fail(nomatch)
 2344:     end;
 2345: compare(B1, B2) when is_binary(B1), is_binary(B2) ->
 2346:     ct:fail(too_much_data);
 2347: compare([X|Rest1], [X|Rest2]) ->
 2348:     compare(Rest1, Rest2);
 2349: compare([_|_], [_|_]) ->
 2350:     ct:fail(nomatch);
 2351: compare([], Remaining) ->
 2352:     Remaining;
 2353: compare(_Data, []) ->
 2354:     ct:fail(too_much_data).
 2355: 
 2356: maybe_to_list(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
 2357:     binary_to_list(Bin);
 2358: maybe_to_list(List) ->
 2359:     List.
 2360: 
 2361: format({Eol,List}) ->
 2362:     io_lib:format("tuple<~w,~w>",[Eol, maybe_to_list(List)]);
 2363: format(List) when is_list(List) ->
 2364:     case list_at_least(50, List) of
 2365:         true ->
 2366:             io_lib:format("\"~-50s...\"", [List]);
 2367:         false ->
 2368:             io_lib:format("~p", [List])
 2369:     end;
 2370: format(Bin) when is_binary(Bin), size(Bin) >= 50 ->
 2371:     io_lib:format("binary<~-50s...>", [binary_to_list(Bin, 1, 50)]);
 2372: format(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
 2373:     io_lib:format("binary<~s>", [binary_to_list(Bin)]).
 2374: 
 2375: 
 2376: list_at_least(Number, [_|Rest]) when Number > 0 ->
 2377:     list_at_least(Number-1, Rest);
 2378: list_at_least(Number, []) when Number > 0 ->
 2379:     false;
 2380: list_at_least(0, _List) -> true.
 2381: 
 2382: 
 2383: %%% Utility functions.
 2384: 
 2385: random_packet(Size) ->
 2386:     random_packet(Size, "").
 2387: 
 2388: random_packet(Size, Prefix) ->
 2389:     build_packet(Size-length(Prefix), lists:reverse(Prefix), random_char()).
 2390: 
 2391: build_packet(0, Result, _NextChar) ->
 2392:     lists:reverse(Result);
 2393: build_packet(Left, Result, NextChar0) ->
 2394:     NextChar =
 2395:     if
 2396:         NextChar0 >= 126 ->
 2397:             33;
 2398:         true ->
 2399:             NextChar0+1
 2400:     end,
 2401:     build_packet(Left-1, [NextChar0|Result], NextChar).
 2402: 
 2403: sizes() ->
 2404:     [10, 13, 64, 127, 128, 255, 256, 1023, 1024,
 2405:      32767, 32768, 65535, 65536].
 2406: 
 2407: sizes(Header_Size) ->
 2408:     sizes(Header_Size, sizes(), []).
 2409: 
 2410: sizes(1, [Packet_Size|Rest], Result) when Packet_Size < 256 ->
 2411:     sizes(1, Rest, [Packet_Size|Result]);
 2412: sizes(2, [Packet_Size|Rest], Result) when Packet_Size < 65536 ->
 2413:     sizes(2, Rest, [Packet_Size|Result]);
 2414: sizes(4, [Packet_Size|Rest], Result) ->
 2415:     sizes(4, Rest, [Packet_Size|Result]);
 2416: sizes(_, _, Result) ->
 2417:     Result.
 2418: 
 2419: random_char() ->
 2420:     random_char("abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVXYZ0123456789").
 2421: 
 2422: random_char(Chars) ->
 2423:     lists:nth(uniform(length(Chars)), Chars).
 2424: 
 2425: uniform(N) ->
 2426:     case rand:export_seed() of
 2427:         undefined ->
 2428:             rand:seed(exsplus),
 2429:             io:format("Random seed = ~p\n", [rand:export_seed()]);
 2430:         _ ->
 2431:             ok
 2432:     end,
 2433:     rand:uniform(N).
 2434: 
 2435: fun_spawn(Fun) ->
 2436:     fun_spawn(Fun, []).
 2437: 
 2438: fun_spawn(Fun, Args) ->
 2439:     spawn_link(erlang, apply, [Fun, Args]).
 2440: 
 2441: port_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2442:     filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "port_test").
 2443: 
 2444: %% Test that erlang:ports/0 returns a consistent snapshot of ports
 2445: ports(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2446:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2447:     ok = load_driver(Path, "exit_drv"),
 2448: 
 2449:     receive after 1000 -> ok end, % Wait for other ports to stabilize
 2450: 
 2451:     OtherPorts = erlang:ports(),
 2452:     io:format("Other ports: ~p\n",[OtherPorts]),
 2453:     MaxPorts = 1024 - length(OtherPorts),
 2454: 
 2455:     TrafficPid = spawn_link(fun() -> ports_traffic(MaxPorts) end),
 2456: 
 2457:     ports_snapshots(100, TrafficPid, OtherPorts),
 2458:     TrafficPid ! {self(),die},
 2459:     receive {TrafficPid, dead} -> ok end,
 2460:     ok.
 2461: 
 2462: ports_snapshots(0, _, _) ->
 2463:     ok;
 2464: ports_snapshots(Iter, TrafficPid, OtherPorts) ->
 2465: 
 2466:     TrafficPid ! start,
 2467:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
 2468: 
 2469:     Snapshot = erlang:ports(),
 2470: 
 2471:     TrafficPid ! {self(), stop},
 2472:     receive {TrafficPid, EventList, TrafficPorts} -> ok end,
 2473: 
 2474:     %%io:format("Snapshot=~p\n", [Snapshot]),
 2475:     ports_verify(Snapshot, OtherPorts ++ TrafficPorts, EventList),
 2476: 
 2477:     ports_snapshots(Iter-1, TrafficPid, OtherPorts).
 2478: 
 2479: 
 2480: ports_traffic(MaxPorts) ->
 2481:     ports_traffic_stopped(MaxPorts, {[],0}).
 2482: 
 2483: ports_traffic_stopped(MaxPorts, {PortList, PortCnt}) ->
 2484:     receive
 2485:         start ->
 2486:             %%io:format("Traffic started in ~p\n",[self()]),
 2487:             ports_traffic_started(MaxPorts, {PortList, PortCnt}, []);
 2488:         {Pid,die} ->
 2489:             lists:foreach(fun(Port)-> erlang:port_close(Port) end,
 2490:                           PortList),
 2491:             Pid ! {self(),dead}
 2492:     end.
 2493: 
 2494: ports_traffic_started(MaxPorts, {PortList, PortCnt}, EventList) ->
 2495:     receive
 2496:         {Pid, stop} ->
 2497:             %%io:format("Traffic stopped in ~p\n",[self()]),
 2498:             Pid ! {self(), EventList, PortList},
 2499:             ports_traffic_stopped(MaxPorts, {PortList, PortCnt})
 2500: 
 2501:     after 0 ->
 2502:               ports_traffic_do(MaxPorts, {PortList, PortCnt}, EventList)
 2503:     end.
 2504: 
 2505: ports_traffic_do(MaxPorts, {PortList, PortCnt}, EventList) ->
 2506:     N = uniform(MaxPorts),
 2507:     case N > PortCnt of
 2508:         true -> % Open port
 2509:             P = open_port({spawn, "exit_drv"}, []),
 2510:             %%io:format("Created port ~p\n",[P]),
 2511:             ports_traffic_started(MaxPorts, {[P|PortList], PortCnt+1},
 2512:                                   [{open,P}|EventList]);
 2513: 
 2514:         false -> % Close port
 2515:             P = lists:nth(N, PortList),
 2516:             %%io:format("Close port ~p\n",[P]),
 2517:             true = erlang:port_close(P),
 2518:             ports_traffic_started(MaxPorts, {lists:delete(P,PortList), PortCnt-1},
 2519:                                   [{close,P}|EventList])
 2520:     end.
 2521: 
 2522: ports_verify(Ports, PortsAfter, EventList) ->
 2523:     %%io:format("Candidate=~p\nEvents=~p\n", [PortsAfter, EventList]),
 2524:     case lists:sort(Ports) =:= lists:sort(PortsAfter) of
 2525:         true ->
 2526:             io:format("Snapshot of ~p ports verified ok.\n",[length(Ports)]),
 2527:             ok;
 2528:         false ->
 2529:             %% Note that we track the event list "backwards", undoing open/close:
 2530:             case EventList of
 2531:                 [{open,P} | Tail] ->
 2532:                     ports_verify(Ports, lists:delete(P,PortsAfter), Tail);
 2533: 
 2534:                 [{close,P} | Tail] ->
 2535:                     ports_verify(Ports, [P | PortsAfter], Tail);
 2536: 
 2537:                 [] ->
 2538:                     ct:fail("Inconsistent snapshot from erlang:ports()")
 2539:             end
 2540:     end.
 2541: 
 2542: load_driver(Dir, Driver) ->
 2543:     case erl_ddll:load_driver(Dir, Driver) of
 2544:         ok -> ok;
 2545:         {error, Error} = Res ->
 2546:             io:format("~s\n", [erl_ddll:format_error(Error)]),
 2547:             Res
 2548:     end.
 2549: 
 2550: 
 2551: %% Send data to port program that does not read it, then close port.
 2552: %% Primary targeting Windows to test threaded_handle_closer in sys.c
 2553: close_deaf_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2554:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
 2555:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2556:     DeadPort = os:find_executable("dead_port", DataDir),
 2557:     Port = open_port({spawn,DeadPort++" 60"},[]),
 2558:     erlang:port_command(Port,"Hello, can you hear me!?!?"),
 2559:     port_close(Port),
 2560: 
 2561:     Res = close_deaf_port_1(0, DeadPort),
 2562:     io:format("Waiting for OS procs to terminate...\n"),
 2563:     receive after 5*1000 -> ok end,
 2564:     Res.
 2565: 
 2566: close_deaf_port_1(200, _) ->
 2567:     ok;
 2568: close_deaf_port_1(N, Cmd) ->
 2569:     Timeout = integer_to_list(rand:uniform(5*1000)),
 2570:     try open_port({spawn_executable,Cmd},[{args,[Timeout]}]) of
 2571:         Port ->
 2572:             erlang:port_command(Port,"Hello, can you hear me!?!?"),
 2573:             port_close(Port),
 2574:             close_deaf_port_1(N+1, Cmd)
 2575:     catch
 2576:         _:eagain ->
 2577:             {comment, "Could not spawn more than " ++ integer_to_list(N) ++ " OS processes."}
 2578:     end.
 2579: 
 2580: %% Test undocumented port_set_data/2 and port_get_data/1
 2581: %% Hammer from multiple processes a while
 2582: %% and then abrubtly close the port (OTP-12208).
 2583: port_setget_data(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2584:     ok = load_driver(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "echo_drv"),
 2585:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv"}, []),
 2586: 
 2587:     NSched = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 2588:     HeapData = {1,2,3,<<"A heap binary">>,fun()->"This is fun"end,
 2589:                 list_to_binary(lists:seq(1,100))},
 2590:     PRs = lists:map(fun(I) ->
 2591:                             spawn_opt(fun() -> port_setget_data_hammer(Port,HeapData,false,1) end,
 2592:                                       [monitor, {scheduler, I rem NSched}])
 2593:                     end,
 2594:                     lists:seq(1,10)),
 2595:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 2596:     Papa = self(),
 2597:     lists:foreach(fun({Pid,_}) -> Pid ! {Papa,prepare_for_close} end, PRs),
 2598:     lists:foreach(fun({Pid,_}) ->
 2599:                           receive {Pid,prepare_for_close} -> ok end
 2600:                   end,
 2601:                   PRs),
 2602:     port_close(Port),
 2603:     lists:foreach(fun({Pid,Ref}) ->
 2604:                           receive {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, normal} -> ok end
 2605:                   end,
 2606:                   PRs),
 2607:     ok.
 2608: 
 2609: port_setget_data_hammer(Port, HeapData, IsSet0, N) ->
 2610:     Rand = rand:uniform(3),
 2611:     IsSet1 = try case Rand of
 2612:                      1 -> true = erlang:port_set_data(Port, atom), true;
 2613:                      2 -> true = erlang:port_set_data(Port, HeapData), true;
 2614:                      3 -> case erlang:port_get_data(Port) of
 2615:                               atom -> true;
 2616:                               HeapData -> true;
 2617:                               undefined -> false=IsSet0
 2618:                           end
 2619:                  end
 2620:              catch
 2621:                  error:badarg ->
 2622:                      true = get(prepare_for_close),
 2623:                      io:format("~p did ~p rounds before port closed\n", [self(), N]),
 2624:                      exit(normal)
 2625:              end,
 2626:     receive {Papa, prepare_for_close} ->
 2627:                 put(prepare_for_close, true),
 2628:                 Papa ! {self(),prepare_for_close}
 2629:     after 0 ->
 2630:               ok
 2631:     end,
 2632:     port_setget_data_hammer(Port, HeapData, IsSet1, N+1).
 2633: 
 2634: 
 2635: wait_until(Fun) ->
 2636:     case catch Fun() of
 2637:         true ->
 2638:             ok;
 2639:         _ ->
 2640:             receive after 100 -> ok end,
 2641:             wait_until(Fun)
 2642:     end.
 2643: 
 2644: %% Attempt to monitor pid as port, and port as pid
 2645: mon_port_invalid_type(_Config) ->
 2646:     Port = hd(erlang:ports()),
 2647:     ?assertError(badarg, erlang:monitor(port, self())),
 2648:     ?assertError(badarg, erlang:monitor(process, Port)),
 2649:     ok.
 2650: 
 2651: %% With local port
 2652: mon_port_local(Config) ->
 2653:     Port1 = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]), % will close after we send 1 byte
 2654:     Ref1 = erlang:monitor(port, Port1),
 2655:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, true, port_monitored_by, true},
 2656:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Port1)),
 2657:     Port1 ! {self(), {command, <<"1">>}}, % port test will close self immediately
 2658:     receive ExitP1 -> ?assertMatch({'DOWN', Ref1, port, Port1, _}, ExitP1)
 2659:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2660:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, false, port_monitored_by, false},
 2661:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Port1)),
 2662: 
 2663:     %% Trying to re-monitor a port which exists but is not healthy will
 2664:     %% succeed but then will immediately send DOWN
 2665:     Ref2 = erlang:monitor(port, Port1),
 2666:     receive ExitP2 -> ?assertMatch({'DOWN', Ref2, port, Port1, _}, ExitP2)
 2667:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2668:     ok.
 2669: 
 2670: %% With remote port on remote node (should fail)
 2671: mon_port_remote_on_remote(_Config) ->
 2672:     Port3 = binary_to_term(<<131, 102,          % Ext term format: PORT_EXT
 2673:                              100, 0, 13, "fgsfds@fgsfds", % Node :: ATOM_EXT
 2674:                              1:32/big,          % Id
 2675:                              0>>),              % Creation
 2676:     ?assertError(badarg, erlang:monitor(port, Port3)),
 2677:     ok.
 2678: 
 2679: %% Remote port belongs to this node and does not exist
 2680: %% Port4 produces #Port<0.167772160> which should not exist in a test run
 2681: mon_port_bad_remote_on_local(_Config) ->
 2682:     Port4 = binary_to_term(<<131, 102,          % Ext term format: PORT_EXT
 2683:                              100, 0, 13, "nonode@nohost", % Node
 2684:                              167772160:32/big,  % Id
 2685:                              0>>),              % Creation
 2686:     ?assertError(badarg, erlang:monitor(port, Port4)),
 2687:     ok.
 2688: 
 2689: %% Monitor owner (origin) dies before port is closed
 2690: mon_port_origin_dies(Config) ->
 2691:     Port5 = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]), % will close after we send 1 byte
 2692:     Self5 = self(),
 2693:     Proc5 = spawn(fun() ->
 2694:                       Self5 ! test5_started,
 2695:                       erlang:monitor(port, Port5),
 2696:                       receive stop -> ok end
 2697:                   end),
 2698:     erlang:monitor(process, Proc5), % we want to sync with its death
 2699:     receive test5_started -> ok
 2700:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2701:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, true, port_monitored_by, true},
 2702:                  port_is_monitored(Proc5, Port5)),
 2703:     Proc5 ! stop,
 2704:     % receive from monitor (removing race condition)
 2705:     receive ExitP5 -> ?assertMatch({'DOWN', _, process, Proc5, _}, ExitP5)
 2706:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2707:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, false, port_monitored_by, false},
 2708:                  port_is_monitored(Proc5, Port5)),
 2709:     Port5 ! {self(), {command, <<"1">>}}, % make port quit
 2710:     ok.
 2711: 
 2712: %% Port and Monitor owner dies before port is closed
 2713: %% This testcase checks for a regression memory leak in erts
 2714: %% when the controlling and monitoring process is the same process
 2715: %% and the process dies
 2716: mon_port_owner_dies(Config) ->
 2717:     Self = self(),
 2718:     Proc = spawn(fun() ->
 2719:                          Port = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]),
 2720:                          Self ! {test_started, Port},
 2721:                          erlang:monitor(port, Port),
 2722:                          receive stop -> ok end
 2723:                   end),
 2724:     erlang:monitor(process, Proc), % we want to sync with its death
 2725:     Port = receive {test_started,P} -> P
 2726:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2727:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, true, port_monitored_by, true},
 2728:                  port_is_monitored(Proc, Port)),
 2729:     Proc ! stop,
 2730:     %% receive from monitor
 2731:     receive ExitP5 -> ?assertMatch({'DOWN', _, process, Proc, _}, ExitP5)
 2732:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2733:     ok.
 2734: 
 2735: %% Monitor a named port
 2736: mon_port_named(Config) ->
 2737:     Name6 = test_port6,
 2738:     Port6 = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]), % will close after we send 1 byte
 2739:     erlang:register(Name6, Port6),
 2740:     erlang:monitor(port, Name6),
 2741:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, true, port_monitored_by, true},
 2742:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Name6)),
 2743:     Port6 ! {self(), {command, <<"1">>}}, % port test will close self immediately
 2744:     receive ExitP6 -> ?assertMatch({'DOWN', _, port, {Name6, _}, _}, ExitP6)
 2745:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2746:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, false, port_monitored_by, false},
 2747:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Name6)),
 2748:     ok.
 2749: 
 2750: %% Named does not exist: Should succeed but immediately send 'DOWN'
 2751: mon_port_bad_named(_Config) ->
 2752:     Name7 = test_port7,
 2753:     erlang:monitor(port, Name7),
 2754:     receive {'DOWN', _, port, {Name7, _}, noproc} -> ok
 2755:     after 1000 -> ?assert(false) end,
 2756:     ok.
 2757: 
 2758: %% Monitor a pid and demonitor by ref
 2759: mon_port_pid_demonitor(Config) ->
 2760:     Port8 = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]), % will close after we send 1 byte
 2761:     Ref8 = erlang:monitor(port, Port8),
 2762:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, true, port_monitored_by, true},
 2763:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Port8)),
 2764:     erlang:demonitor(Ref8),
 2765:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, false, port_monitored_by, false},
 2766:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Port8)),
 2767:     Port8 ! {self(), {command, <<"1">>}}, % port test will close self immediately
 2768:     ok.
 2769: 
 2770: %% Monitor by name and demonitor by ref
 2771: mon_port_name_demonitor(Config) ->
 2772:     Name9 = test_port9,
 2773:     Port9 = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]), % will close after we send 1 byte
 2774:     erlang:register(Name9, Port9),
 2775:     Ref9 = erlang:monitor(port, Name9),
 2776:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, true, port_monitored_by, true},
 2777:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Name9)),
 2778:     erlang:demonitor(Ref9),
 2779:     ?assertMatch({proc_monitors, false, port_monitored_by, false},
 2780:                  port_is_monitored(self(), Name9)),
 2781:     Port9 ! {self(), {command, <<"1">>}}, % port test will close self immediately
 2782:     ok.
 2783: 
 2784: %% 1. Spawn a port which will sleep 3 seconds
 2785: %% 2. Port driver and dies horribly (via C driver_failure call). This should
 2786: %%    mark port as exiting or something.
 2787: %% 3. While the command happens, a monitor is requested on the port
 2788: mon_port_driver_die(Config) ->
 2789:     erlang:process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 2790: 
 2791:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2792:     ok = load_driver(Path, "sleep_failure_drv"),
 2793:     Port = open_port({spawn, "sleep_failure_drv"}, []),
 2794: 
 2795:     Self = self(),
 2796:     erlang:spawn_opt(fun() ->
 2797:                              timer:sleep(250),
 2798:                              Ref = erlang:monitor(port, Port),
 2799:                              %% Now check that msg actually arrives
 2800:                              receive
 2801:                                  {'DOWN', Ref, _Port2, _, _} = M -> Self ! M
 2802:                              after 3000 -> Self ! no_down_message
 2803:                              end
 2804:                      end,[{scheduler, 2}]),
 2805:     Port ! {self(), {command, "Fail, please!"}},
 2806:     receive
 2807:         A when is_atom(A) -> ?assertEqual(A, 'A_should_be_printed');
 2808:         {'DOWN', _R, port, Port, noproc} -> ok;
 2809:         {'DOWN', _R, _P, _, _} = M -> ct:fail({got_wrong_down,M})
 2810:     after 5000 -> ?assert(false)
 2811:     end,
 2812:     ok.
 2813: 
 2814: mon_port_down_sig(Config) ->
 2815:     ct:log("By id with immediate reason"),
 2816:     chk_port_down(Config, undefined, bye),
 2817:     ct:log("By id with non-immediate reason"),
 2818:     chk_port_down(Config, undefined, {bye, bye}),
 2819:     ct:log("By name with immediate reason"),
 2820:     chk_port_down(Config, a_port_test_name, bye),
 2821:     ct:log("By name with non-immediate reason"),
 2822:     chk_port_down(Config, another_port_test_name, {bye, bye}),
 2823:     ok.
 2824: 
 2825: chk_port_down(Config, Name, Reason) ->
 2826:     Port = create_port(Config, ["-h1", "-q"]), % will close after we send 1 byte
 2827:     true = is_port(Port),
 2828:     {MonWhat, DownItem} = if Name == undefined ->
 2829:                                   {Port, Port};
 2830:                              true ->
 2831:                                   true = register(Name, Port),
 2832:                                   {Name, {Name, node()}}
 2833:                           end,
 2834:     Mon = erlang:monitor(port, MonWhat),
 2835:     unlink(Port),
 2836:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 2837:     Proc = spawn(fun () ->
 2838:                          link(Port),
 2839:                          exit(Reason)
 2840:                  end),
 2841:     receive
 2842:         {'DOWN', Mon, Type, Item, ExitReason} ->
 2843:             port = Type,
 2844:             Reason = ExitReason,
 2845:             DownItem = Item
 2846:     end,
 2847:     false = is_process_alive(Proc),
 2848:     ok.
 2849: 
 2850: -ifdef(DISABLED_TESTCASE).
 2851: %% 1. Spawn a port which will sleep 3 seconds
 2852: %% 2. Monitor port
 2853: %% 3. Port driver and dies horribly (via C driver_failure call). This should
 2854: %%    mark port as exiting or something.
 2855: %% 4. While the command happens, a demonitor is requested on the port
 2856: mon_port_driver_die_demonitor(Config) ->
 2857:     erlang:process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 2858: 
 2859:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2860:     ok = load_driver(Path, "sleep_failure_drv"),
 2861:     Port = open_port({spawn, "sleep_failure_drv"}, []),
 2862: 
 2863:     Self = self(),
 2864:     erlang:spawn_opt(
 2865:       fun() ->
 2866:               Ref = erlang:monitor(port, Port),
 2867:               Self ! Ref,
 2868:               timer:sleep(250),
 2869:               erlang:demonitor(Ref),
 2870:               %% Now check that msg still arrives,
 2871:               %% the demon should have arrived after
 2872:               %% the port exited
 2873:               receive
 2874:                   {'DOWN', Ref, _Port2, _, _} = M -> Self ! M
 2875:               after 3000 -> Self ! no_down_message
 2876:               end
 2877:       end,[{scheduler, 2}]),
 2878:     Ref = receive R -> R end,
 2879:     Port ! {self(), {command, "Fail, please!"}},
 2880:     receive
 2881:         {'DOWN', Ref, port, Port, normal} -> ok;
 2882:         {'DOWN', _R, _P, _, _} = M -> ct:fail({got_wrong_down,M})
 2883:     after 5000 -> ?assert(false)
 2884:     end,
 2885:     ok.
 2886: -endif.
 2887: 
 2888: %% @doc Makes a controllable port for testing. Underlying mechanism of this
 2889: %% port is not important, only important is our ability to close/kill it or
 2890: %% have it monitored.
 2891: create_port(Config, Args) ->
 2892:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir, Config),
 2893:     %% Borrow port test utility from port SUITE
 2894:     Program = filename:join([DataDir, "port_test"]),
 2895:     erlang:open_port({spawn_executable, Program}, [{args, Args}]).
 2896: 
 2897: %% @doc Checks if process Pid exists, and if so, if its monitoring (or not)
 2898: %% the Port (or if port doesn't exist, we assume answer is no).
 2899: port_is_monitored(Pid, Port) when is_pid(Pid), is_port(Port) ->
 2900:     %% Variant for when port is a port id (port())
 2901:     A = case erlang:process_info(Pid, monitors) of
 2902:             undefined -> false;
 2903:             {monitors, ProcMTargets} -> lists:member({port, Port}, ProcMTargets)
 2904:         end,
 2905:     B = case erlang:port_info(Port, monitored_by) of
 2906:             undefined -> false;
 2907:             {monitored_by, PortMonitors} -> lists:member(Pid, PortMonitors)
 2908:         end,
 2909:     {proc_monitors, A, port_monitored_by, B};
 2910: port_is_monitored(Pid, PortName) when is_pid(Pid), is_atom(PortName) ->
 2911:     %% Variant for when port is an atom
 2912:     A = case erlang:process_info(Pid, monitors) of
 2913:         undefined -> false;
 2914:         {monitors, ProcMTargets} ->
 2915:             lists:member({port, {PortName, node()}}, ProcMTargets)
 2916:     end,
 2917:     B = case erlang:whereis(PortName) of
 2918:             undefined -> false; % name is not registered or is dead
 2919:             PortId ->
 2920:                 case erlang:port_info(PortId, monitored_by) of
 2921:                     undefined -> false; % is dead
 2922:                     {monitored_by, PortMonitors} ->
 2923:                         lists:member(Pid, PortMonitors)
 2924:                 end
 2925:         end,
 2926:     {proc_monitors, A, port_monitored_by, B}.
 2927: 
 2928: %%
 2929: %%
 2930: %% Test cases testing for races when an exiting port receives a signal
 2931: %% (port_exit_signal_race group).
 2932: %%
 2933: %%
 2934: 
 2935: -record(esrt, {repeat = 1000,
 2936:                owner_sched = 0,
 2937:                prep_owner = fun (Prt) -> Prt end,
 2938:                post_owner = fun (_) -> ok end,
 2939:                send_sched_start = 0,
 2940:                senders = 1,
 2941:                prep_signal = fun (Prt, PrtOwn) -> {Prt, PrtOwn} end,
 2942:                signal,
 2943:                post_signal = fun (_) -> ok end}).
 2944: 
 2945: port_exit_monitor_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2946:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 2947:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, _PrtOwn}) ->
 2948:                                        {Port, erlang:monitor(port, Port)}
 2949:                                end,
 2950:                       post_signal = fun ({Port, Mon}) ->
 2951:                                             receive
 2952:                                                 {'DOWN', Mon, port, Port, Reason} ->
 2953:                                                     if Reason == noproc -> ok;
 2954:                                                        Reason == normal -> ok;
 2955:                                                        true -> exit({unexpected_reason, Reason})
 2956:                                                     end
 2957:                                             after
 2958:                                                 1000 ->
 2959:                                                     exit(missing_down_message)
 2960:                                             end
 2961:                                     end},
 2962:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 2963: 
 2964: port_exit_demonitor_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2965:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 2966:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{prep_signal = fun (Port, _PrtOwn) ->
 2967:                                             erlang:monitor(port, Port)
 2968:                                     end,
 2969:                       signal = fun (Mon) ->
 2970:                                        erlang:demonitor(Mon, [flush])
 2971:                                end},
 2972:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 2973: 
 2974: port_exit_link_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2975:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 2976:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{prep_signal = fun (Port, _PrtOwn) ->
 2977:                                             process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 2978:                                             Port
 2979:                                     end,
 2980:                       signal = fun (Port) ->
 2981:                                        link(Port),
 2982:                                        Port
 2983:                                end,
 2984:                       post_signal = fun (Port) ->
 2985:                                             receive
 2986:                                                 {'EXIT', Port, Reason} ->
 2987:                                                     if Reason == noproc -> ok;
 2988:                                                        Reason == normal -> ok;
 2989:                                                        true -> exit({unexpected_reason, Reason})
 2990:                                                     end
 2991:                                             after
 2992:                                                 1000 ->
 2993:                                                     exit(missing_exit_message)
 2994:                                             end
 2995:                                     end},
 2996:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 2997: 
 2998: port_exit_unlink_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2999:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3000:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{prep_signal = fun (Port, _PrtOwn) ->
 3001:                                             process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 3002:                                             link(Port),
 3003:                                             Port
 3004:                                     end,
 3005:                       signal = fun (Port) ->
 3006:                                        unlink(Port),
 3007:                                        Port
 3008:                                end,
 3009:                       post_signal = fun (Port) ->
 3010:                                             receive
 3011:                                                 {'EXIT', Port, Reason} ->
 3012:                                                     if Reason == noproc -> ok;
 3013:                                                        Reason == normal -> ok;
 3014:                                                        true -> exit({unexpected_reason, Reason})
 3015:                                                     end
 3016:                                             after
 3017:                                                 0 ->
 3018:                                                     ok
 3019:                                             end
 3020:                                     end},
 3021:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3022: 
 3023: port_exit_command_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3024:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3025:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, PortOwner}) ->
 3026:                                        Port ! {PortOwner, {command, "halloj"}},
 3027:                                        Port
 3028:                                end,
 3029:                       post_signal = fun (Port) ->
 3030:                                             receive
 3031:                                                 {Port, Data} ->
 3032:                                                     {data, "halloj"} = Data
 3033:                                             after
 3034:                                                 0 ->
 3035:                                                     ok
 3036:                                             end
 3037:                                     end},
 3038:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3039: 
 3040: port_exit_connect_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3041:     %% We connect the port to the same port owner that it already has
 3042:     %% otherwise we will get badsig issues since the owner close the
 3043:     %% port as itself. The port owner will be spammed by {Port,
 3044:     %% connected} messages but we ignore those...
 3045:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3046:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, PortOwner}) ->
 3047:                                        Port ! {PortOwner, {connect, PortOwner}},
 3048:                                        Port
 3049:                                end},
 3050:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3051: 
 3052: 
 3053: port_exit_close_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3054:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3055:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, PortOwner}) ->
 3056:                                        Port ! {PortOwner, close},
 3057:                                        Port
 3058:                                end},
 3059:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3060: 
 3061: port_exit_exit_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3062:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3063:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, _PortOwner}) ->
 3064:                                        exit(Port, normal)
 3065:                                end},
 3066:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3067: 
 3068: port_exit_command_request_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3069:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3070:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, _PortOwner}) ->
 3071:                                        true = try
 3072:                                                   erlang:port_command(Port, "hejsan")
 3073:                                               catch
 3074:                                                   error:badarg ->
 3075:                                                       true
 3076:                                               end,
 3077:                                        Port
 3078:                                end,
 3079:                       post_signal = fun (Port) ->
 3080:                                             receive
 3081:                                                 {Port, Data} ->
 3082:                                                     {data, "hejsan"} = Data
 3083:                                             after
 3084:                                                 0 ->
 3085:                                                     ok
 3086:                                             end
 3087:                                     end},
 3088:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3089: 
 3090: port_exit_connect_request_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3091:     %% We connect the port to the same port owner that it already has
 3092:     %% otherwise we will get badsig issues since the owner close the
 3093:     %% port as itself.
 3094:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3095:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, PortOwner}) ->
 3096:                                        true = try
 3097:                                                   erlang:port_connect(Port, PortOwner)
 3098:                                               catch
 3099:                                                   error:badarg ->
 3100:                                                       true
 3101:                                               end
 3102:                                end},
 3103:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3104: 
 3105: port_exit_close_request_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3106:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3107:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, _PortOwner}) ->
 3108:                                        true = try
 3109:                                                   erlang:port_close(Port)
 3110:                                               catch
 3111:                                                   error:badarg ->
 3112:                                                       true
 3113:                                               end,
 3114:                                        Port
 3115:                                end},
 3116:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3117: 
 3118: port_exit_control_request_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3119:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3120:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, _PortOwner}) ->
 3121:                                        [] = try
 3122:                                                 erlang:port_control(Port, 0, [])
 3123:                                             catch
 3124:                                                 error:badarg ->
 3125:                                                     []
 3126:                                             end
 3127:                                end},
 3128:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3129: 
 3130: port_exit_call_request_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3131:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3132:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, _PortOwner}) ->
 3133:                                        [] = try
 3134:                                                 erlang:port_call(Port, 0, term_to_binary([]))
 3135:                                             catch
 3136:                                                 error:badarg ->
 3137:                                                     []
 3138:                                             end
 3139:                                end},
 3140:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3141: 
 3142: port_exit_info_request_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3143:     ESRT0 = prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config),
 3144:     ESRT = ESRT0#esrt{signal = fun ({Port, PortOwner}) ->
 3145:                                        case erlang:port_info(Port, connected) of
 3146:                                            {connected, PortOwner} -> ok;
 3147:                                            undefined -> ok;
 3148:                                            Unexpected -> exit({unexpected_info, Unexpected})
 3149:                                        end
 3150:                                end},
 3151:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT).
 3152: 
 3153: 
 3154: prepare_port_exit_signal_race_test(Config) ->
 3155:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 3156:     ok = load_driver(Path, "echo_drv"),
 3157:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 3158:     case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
 3159:         1 ->
 3160:             #esrt{};
 3161:         2 ->
 3162:             #esrt{owner_sched = 2,
 3163:                   send_sched_start = 1,
 3164:                   senders = 1};
 3165:         3 ->
 3166:             #esrt{owner_sched = 2,
 3167:                   send_sched_start = 3,
 3168:                   senders = 1};
 3169:         N ->
 3170:             #esrt{owner_sched = 2,
 3171:                   send_sched_start = 3,
 3172:                   senders = N - 3}
 3173:     end.
 3174: 
 3175: repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(#esrt{repeat = N} = ESRT) ->
 3176:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(N, ESRT).
 3177: 
 3178: repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(0, #esrt{}) ->
 3179:     ok;
 3180: repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(N, #esrt{} = ESRT) ->
 3181:     port_exit_signal_race_test(ESRT),
 3182:     repeat_port_exit_signal_race_test(N-1, ESRT).
 3183: 
 3184: port_exit_signal_race_test(#esrt{owner_sched = OwnSched,
 3185:                                  prep_owner = PrepOwner,
 3186:                                  post_owner = PostOwner,
 3187:                                  send_sched_start = SendSchedStart,
 3188:                                  senders = Senders,
 3189:                                  prep_signal = PrepSignal,
 3190:                                  signal = Signal,
 3191:                                  post_signal = PostSignal}) ->
 3192:     %% Send a close signal to the port simultaneously as another signal
 3193:     %% is sent (from multiple senders). We try to provoke races between
 3194:     %% the port entering an exiting state and handling of the signal. Such
 3195:     %% races have shown themselves as either stray messages to signal
 3196:     %% sender or runtime system crashes.
 3197:     Parent = self(),
 3198:     {PrtOwn,
 3199:      PrtOwnMon} = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 3200:                                     Prt = erlang:open_port({spawn_driver, "echo_drv"}, []),
 3201:                                     true = is_port(Prt),
 3202:                                     OwnState = PrepOwner(Prt),
 3203:                                     Prt ! {self(), {command, "hej"}},
 3204:                                     receive
 3205:                                         {Prt, Data} ->
 3206:                                             {data, "hej"} = Data
 3207:                                     end,
 3208:                                     Parent ! {prepared, self(), Prt},
 3209:                                     receive {go, Parent} -> ok end,
 3210:                                     Prt ! {self(), close},
 3211:                                     PostOwner(OwnState)
 3212:                             end,
 3213:                             [link, monitor, {scheduler, OwnSched}]),
 3214:     Port = receive {prepared, PrtOwn, Prt} -> Prt end,
 3215:     PMs = lists:map(fun (SendSched) ->
 3216:                             spawn_opt(fun () ->
 3217:                                               PrtMon = erlang:monitor(port, Port),
 3218:                                               SigState1 = PrepSignal(Port, PrtOwn),
 3219:                                               Parent ! {prepared, self()},
 3220:                                               receive {go, Parent} -> ok end,
 3221:                                               SigState2 = Signal(SigState1),
 3222:                                               receive {'DOWN', PrtMon, port, Port, _} -> ok end,
 3223:                                               receive {bye, Parent} -> ok end,
 3224:                                               PostSignal(SigState2),
 3225:                                               receive Msg -> exit({unexpected_msg, Msg})
 3226:                                               after 0 -> ok
 3227:                                               end
 3228:                                       end,
 3229:                                       [link, monitor, {scheduler, SendSched}])
 3230:                     end,
 3231:                     lists:seq(SendSchedStart, SendSchedStart + Senders - 1)), 
 3232:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, _M}) -> receive {prepared, P} -> ok end end, PMs),
 3233:     PrtOwn ! {go, self()},
 3234:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, _M}) -> P ! {go, self()} end, PMs),
 3235:     receive
 3236:         {'DOWN', PrtOwnMon, process, PrtOwn, OwnReason} ->
 3237:             normal = OwnReason
 3238:     end,
 3239:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, _M}) -> P ! {bye, self()} end, PMs),
 3240:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, M}) ->
 3241:                           receive
 3242:                               {'DOWN', M, process, P, SigSndReason} ->
 3243:                                   normal = SigSndReason
 3244:                           end
 3245:                   end,
 3246:                   PMs),
 3247:     ok.
 3248: 
 3249: %%
 3250: %%
 3251: %% End of test cases testing for races when an exiting port receives a signal
 3252: %% (port_exit_signal_race group).
